title: ragnvindr_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. Also known as the "Dawn Knight", he lived during Mondstadt's Aristocratic period around 1000 years before the events of the game. He is the namesake of the Ragnvindr Clan, an ancestor of [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]] and [[Crepus (genshin impact)|]] and the earliest known owner of [[Dawn Winery]].

Originally, Ragnvindr served as a knight's squire during the Aristocratic period, after the Lawrence Clan and other nobles houses grew corrupt. Unable to ignore the people's suffering, he grew dissatisfied with how the aristocracy ran the city and oppressed it's citizens, but was bound to his duties as a knight. 

He met and befriended the Dawnlight Swordswoman of the Wanderer's Troupe and later witnessed her death in the arena, later burying her with her sword, [[The Flute (genshin impact)|]]. Ragnvindr adopted the title of "Dawn Knight" for himself after the Dawnlight Swordswoman and joined [[Vennessa (genshin impact)|]]'s rebellion against the aristocracy, where they eventually emerged victorious with assistance from [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Ragnvindr":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Ragnvindr

title: knife
body:
A tool or [[weapon]] consisting of a short blade and a handle, used for cutting, stabbing, or slashing.

A knife can be a [[weapon]], such as a [[dagger]] or [[combat knife]], a utensil, such as a [[kitchen knife]] or [[butter knife]], or a tool, such as a pocket knife or a [[Swiss army knife]].

h4. Related tags

title: crepus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]], he is previous head of the [[Dawn Winery]]. He is the biological father of [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]], adoptive father of [[Kaeya (genshin impact)|]] and a descendant of [[Ragnvindr (genshin impact)|]].

Crepus was a talented winemaker and his former employees, such as [[Elzer (genshin impact)|]], [[Adelinde (genshin impact)|]] and [[Connor (genshin impact)|]] held great respect for him. He also took in [[Kaeya (genshin impact)|]] as his son after he was abandonded at the winery. When Crepus was young, he dreamed of joining the Knights of Favonius but did not qualify. He wished that his son, [[Diluc (genshin impact)|]] would become the most esteemed of knights, which pushed Diluc to train rigorously and Diluc would eventually become the youngest cavalry captain in the knights' history. 

While on the road after leaving a celebraton at Angel's Share tavern, Crepus and Diluc's transport tavern were attacked by [[Ursa the Drake]]. Many were killed and before the monster could attack again, Crepus activated his [[Delusion (genshin impact)|]] to protect his son and defeat Ursa. The effects from the Delusion were so great that he was mortally wound and passed away in Diluc's arms shortly after.

Crepus bares a strong resemblance to his son, having [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] and a [[red facial hair|red]] [[beard]]. He wore a [[black coat]], a [[white vest|white]] [[double-breasted]] [[vest]] with a [[black shirt|black]] [[collared shirt]], a [[red necktie]], [[black gloves]] and [[black pants]].

h4. See also

* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Crepus":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Crepus

title: folding_knife
body:
A knife with a blade that folds into the handle, also known as a pocketknife, jackknives, EDC knife, and maybe penknife, though that may be a specific kind of folding knofe. There are thousands of variations in the industry, with handle materials ranging from composite to wood to carbon fiber to titanium, and blades made from various types of steel. A typical blade length is 5 to 15 centimeters (2 to 6 in).

h4. See also

* [[balisong]]
* [[switchblade]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Pocketknife":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pocketknife

title: angry_birds
body:
[i]Angry Birds[/i] is an application for the [[iphone|iOS]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] Phone, Bada, Symbian, webOS, Android and Maemo mobile operating systems. It was released by Rovio Entertainment and made in Helsinki, Finland. The objective of the game is to eliminate the [[Bad Piggies]] and destroy their buildings and structures at the same time. This is done by the birds launching themselves out of a giant [[slingshot (weapon)|]] and hitting the pigs' various constructs, henceforth eliminating them. Each level allots the player a certain number of birds, which must be used in the order provided.

h4. Playable Characters

title: siege_(arknights)
body:
[i]Siege, leader of the Glasgow Gang, will carve a path for you[/i]

A playable Vanguard Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: [spoiler]Alexandrina Victoria[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Victoria[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 10[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Aslan[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]172 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]5 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Also known as Vina, the leader of the Glasgow Gang, a squad full of former Londinium street punks which were forced to come to the Island. Her natural command, courage, and composure on the battlefield have made her one of the best operators employed by Rhodes Island. Her choice of weapon is a hammer.

[spoilers]Her real name is Alexandrina Victoria and she is the heir of the Aslan kings to the throne of Victoria. After the assassination of her father, she hid herself in the slums of Londinium where she became the leader of the Glasgow Gang, but she had to flee her homeland along with her entourage and seek refuge at Rhodes Island.

During the Victorian civil war, she returned to Londinium to help the people in need.[/spoilers]

Her characteristics draw many parallels to [[Saber (fate)|]] from the Fate series. They both have the same voice actress, blond hair, lions motifs, and are affiliated with the United Kingdom Royalty (the Kingdom of Victoria in Arknights being heavily based on the UK).

She has [[blonde hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[lion ears]] and a [[lion tail]]. She wears [[red shorts|red]] [[short shorts]], a [[white tank top]], [[black jacket|black]] [[leather jacket]] and [[studded choker]].

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Kawasumi Ayako]] (Japanese), Shuang Liang (Chinese), Claudia Jolly (English), and Gabin (Korean). Her art designer is [[Infukun]].

h4. Appearance

title: star_dream_soul_os
body:
The upgraded version of [[Star Dream]] and true final boss of [[Kirby: Planet Robobot]], fought at the end of the True Arena. It's implied that the soul of [[Max Profitt Haltmann|President Haltmann]], still lingering within the machine, is being purged from its system as the battle goes on.

On the first phase, the Mother Computer has a noticeably different appearance, consisting of a golden, red, black and white color scheme and a large crack across the front from a blow dealt by [[Galacta Knight]] in a previous battle. On its third phase, its clockwork star form's color more closely resembles [[Galactic Nova]].

The battle's final phase is completely different, involving [[Kirby]] being abducted into Star Dream and facing off its core, a robotic [[heart]], until it finally [[broken heart|breaks]].
H4. External links
* "WiKirby":https://wikirby.com/wiki/Star_Dream_Soul_OS

title: komaniya_express_(genshin_impact)
body:
A company from [[Genshin Impact]], they are a famous delivery company that is based in Inazuma.

Originally providing services exclusively in Inazuma, the company has begun to expand their services internationally, mainly due to their increased reputation and punctual deliveries after hiring the [[nekomata]] [[Kirara (genshin impact)|]].

The Komaniya Express and their logo seem to be based on [[Yamato Transport]], one of the largest delivery companies in Japan.

Only apply this tag if the company's [[cardboard box]] or reference to the company is seen.

While her original art designer is [[Infukun]], this alter is credited to [[Studio Montagne]], the development team of Arknights.

title: unzen_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Unzen[/i]. Character designed by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Mimori Suzuko]]. 

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] that [[hair over one eye|covers her left eye]], [[purple eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[floral print]] [[white dress]] with a [[side slit]], [[wide sleeves]] colored purple and themed as wings, [[black footwear|black]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[high heels]], [[white coat]], and large [[butterfly wings]] to the back of her clothes. Her [[rigging]] consists of a large white circle to her back with a [[sakuramon]] and [[radar]] antenna plus six 100 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]], and two hull pieces, one on each side, containing her four 203 mm triple mounts.

It is debatable as to whether or not plans for [i]Unzen[/i] actually existed due to the destruction of sensitive information by the IJN prior to surrender. What is known is that a triple 203 mm gun mount, never actually mounted on any Japanese CA, was considered for eight ships planned under the Sixth Naval Armaments Program but no other information has survived. Certain postwar sources such as [i]Japanese Cruisers of the Pacific War[/i] and [i]Uncompleted Fleet Plan - 1917~1950[/i], from where the [i]Unzen[/i]/[i][[Zao (cruiser)|Zaou]][/i] design was based from, are informed guesses.

However, more information surfaces that the Zao-class cruisers are confirmed to be "Type A 1941 Heavy Cruiser" projects in which is derive to the later Mogami and Tone-class cruisers, armed with a Triple 203mm experimental mount and Experimental Torpedo mount.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6682481: Default
* !post #6703642: [[Unzen (sojourn through clear seas) (azur lane)|Sojourn Through Clear Seas]]
* !post #9954345: [[Unzen (arcane ninja knowledge) (azur lane)|Arcane Ninja Knowledge]]

title: fremen
body:
The [b]Fremen[/b] (pronounced /ˈfrɛmən/) are a group of people in the fictional [[Dune (series)|]] universe created by Frank Herbert. 

First appearing in the 1965 [[science fiction]] novel [i]Dune[/i], the Fremen inhabit the [[desert]] [[planet]] [[Dune (planet)|Arrakis]] and are based on the desert-dwelling Bedouin and Kalahari Bushmen. 

In Herbert's novels, Arrakis (also known as Dune) is the sole known source of the all-important spice melange in the universe. 

The Fremen originated from human refugees and outcasts from different planetary colonies who traveled across space and ended in the then unexplored desert planet centuries in the past, becoming initially a group known as "The [b]Fre[/b]e [b]Men[/b] of Arrakis". 

As humans [i]in extremis[/i], over time they adapted their culture and way of life to survive and thrive in the incredibly harsh conditions of Arrakis. The Fremen are distinguished by their fierce fighting abilities and adeptness at survival in these conditions. With [[water]] such a rare commodity on the planet, their culture revolves around its preservation and conservation.

The Fremen spend all time out in the desert inside a [[stillsuit]], a special body-enclosing suit designed to collect and recycle body water.

It is generally considered a great sign of respect (though often interpreted otherwise) for a Fremen to spit [[saliva]] before a person, because of their water conservation routine. They also put a great reverence on crying. [[Tears]] shed for someone who has died are referred to as "Water Given To The Dead."

h4. See also

* [[Dune (series)]]
* [[Dune (2021 movie)]]
* [[Chani]]
* [[Stilgar]]

* [[Crysknife]]

* [[Sandworm (dune)|]]

title: dune_(series)
body:
A 1965 science fiction novel written by Frank Herbert. It won the Hugo Award in 1966, and the inaugural Nebula Award for Best Novel. Dune is frequently cited as the world's best-selling [[science fiction]] novel of all time.

Set thousands of years into the far future, amidst a sprawling feudal interstellar empire where planetary fiefdoms are controlled by noble houses that owe an allegiance to the Imperial House Corrino, Dune tells the story of young [[Paul Atreides]] (the heir apparent to Duke [[Leto Atreides]] and the heir of House Atreides) as he and his family accept control of the [[desert]] [[planet]] [[Dune (planet)|Arrakis]], the only source of the "spice" melange, the most important and valuable substance in the universe. The story explores the complex and multi-layered interactions of politics, religion, ecology, technology, and human emotion, as the forces of the Empire confront each other for control of Arrakis and its "spice".

Herbert wrote five sequels to the novel Dune: [i]Dune Messiah, Children of Dune, God Emperor of Dune, Heretics of Dune,[/i] and [i]Chapterhouse: Dune[/i]. The first novel has been adapted into a 1984 film by David Lynch, a 2000 Sci-Fi Channel miniseries [i]Frank Herbert's Dune[/i] and its 2003 sequel [i]Frank Herbert's Children of Dune[/i], and a 2021/2024 two-part film by Denis Villeneuve, as well as computer games, a board game, and songs. The franchise has also been continued beyond Herbert's death in 1986, with a series of prequels, interquels, and sequels that were co-written by Kevin J. Anderson and the author's son, Brian Herbert, starting in 1999.

title: dune_(planet)
body:
Dune, formally known as [i]Arrakis[/i], is a [[desert]] [[planet]] featured in the [[Dune (series)|]] series.

In Dune, the planet is the home of the [[Fremen]] and the only source of "Spice" in the universe. Arrakis is the third planet orbiting the star Canopus, and it in turn is orbited by two moons, one of which has the image of the desert kangaroo mouse, "Muad'Dib", on it; the other moon possesses the image of a human hand.

On April 5, 2010, a real-world plain of Saturn's moon Titan was named "Arrakis Planitia" after Herbert's fictional planet.

h4. See also

* [[Sandworm (dune)|]]
* [[Dune (series)|]]

title: crysknife
body:
A fictional melee personal weapon from the [[dune_(series)|DUNE]] [[science fiction]] series.

A [b]crysknife[/b] is a [[knife]] whose blade is made from the tooth of a dead [[sandworm (dune)|]] of [[dune_(planet)|Arrakis]]. It is the weapon of choice for the [[Fremen]], the natives of Arrakis.

title: adrien_agreste
body:
A teen model from a rich family and the secondary protagonist of [i][[Miraculous Ladybug]][/i]. Can transform into the superhero [[Chat Noir]]. Has a crush on [[Ladybug (miraculous ladybug)|]], and is the object of desire of [[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]].

h4. Transformations/Variations
* [[Chat Blanc]]
* [[Chat Walker]]
* [[Claw Noir]]
* [[Mister bug (miraculous ladybug)|]]

title: felix_(miraculous_ladybug)
body:
[[Chat Noir]]'s civilian identity from [[prototype design|the beta premise]] of [i][[Miraculous Ladybug]][/i]. Originally he didn't have a name, but both community and creator decided Felix as his name.

Supposedly, he was an aloof and cold character, with a string of bad luck occurring around him because of a magic ring currently stuck on his finger. The reason he chased after [[ladybug (miraculous ladybug)|Ladybug]] was because he was told that a kiss from her would remove the ring.

His Chat Noir form and [[adrien_agreste|Adrien's]] are very similar, but Felix has shoulder-length [[blonde hair]], prominent [[blue eyes]] instead of [[green eyes|green]], and a larger [[bell]] on his [[bodysuit]].

Felix's design and name were later retooled into Adrien's cousin [[Felix Fathom]].

title: miraculous_ladybug
body:
A [[magical girl]]/superhero joint effort by France's Zagtoon and Method Animation studios with [[Toei Company]]. It received a promotional video in 2012, followed by a trailer in 2013; the series proper premiered in Korea in September 2015, in France in October 2015, and in the US in December 2015.

[[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] is an ordinary high-schooler living in Paris. After inheriting a pair of magic ladybug earrings, she gains the power to become the superheroine [[Ladybug (miraculous ladybug)|]]. Her superpower is the Power of Luck - if she uses it for altruistic purposes only. Joining in her adventures is a black-clothed [[cat boy]] named [[Chat Noir]] (whose secret identity [[Adrien Agreste]] happens to be the boy Marinette has a crush on), a [[mime]] villain, another villain who fights with an army of [[pigeon]]s, and a mysterious elderly man with a [[butterfly]] motif.

h4. See also

* [[Felix (miraculous ladybug)|]] - Adrien's beta design

h4. External links

* "Official site":http://zagtoon.com/?p=shows&s=ladybug
* "Ladybug PV":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FlwV3scCgAM
other_names: ミラキュラス・レディバグ

title: chat_noir
body:
[quote]For the [[Granblue Fantasy]] character with the same name, use [[Chat Noir (Granblue Fantasy)]].
[/quote]

The superhero identity of [[Adrien Agreste]] of [i][[Miraculous Ladybug]][/i] and [[Felix (miraculous ladybug)|]] in the series' beta premise. Showy and flirtatious to an extent. Very smitten with [[ladybug (miraculous ladybug)|Ladybug]].

Wears a [[superhero costume]] consisting of a black [[bodysuit]] with a [[bell]] and [[cat ears]]. Gains cat-like characteristics with [[green sclera]].

Unlike other [[zombie]]s, they can't be killed by destroying the head and can sprout various mutations, from extra arms to strong legs and so on.

title: the_lord_of_the_rings
body:
An epic high [[fantasy]] novel written by J. R. R. Tolkien. It is part of [[Tolkien's Legendarium]], being a sequel to both [[The Hobbit]] and [[The Silmarillion]]. Received a trilogy movie adaptation directed by Peter Jackson between 2001 - 2003, which was considered to be one of the best movie trilogies ever made.

[i]The Lord of the Rings[/i] is also one of the most influential fantasy fictional works, as several elements from the novel (and movies to an extent) such as characteristics of the [[orc]]s and [[elf|elves]] were later adapted into other subsequent fantasy media.

title: luo_tianyi
body:
Luo Tianyi is a Chinese [[VOCALOID]] distributed by Shanghai HENIAN Co. Ltd, and was released for the VOCALOID3 engine. Created for the [[Vsinger (vocaloid)|]] project, she is formerly known as Yayin Gongyu (雅音宫羽), an original Vocaloid character illustrated by MOTH.

Her finalized appearance was illustrated by [[ideolo]]. She has [[green eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[sidelocks]]. She wears a matching stripe top and [[skirt]], yellow [[necktie]] with a [[choker]], a [[single thighhigh]] and [[single kneehigh|kneehigh]], and [[boots]].

She's popularly paired with [[Yuezheng Ling]], another Vocaloid.

title: tendu
body: A common movement in [[ballet]] that involves standing on one leg (the [i]supporting[/i] leg), sliding the other foot (the [i]working[/i] leg) out to the front, side, or back, and positioning the working leg's foot [[en pointe]] while keeping the supporting leg's foot flat on the ground.

title: kagamine_len
body:
Kagamine Len is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. He is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Rin]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. He is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for his V2 voicebank. His V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

He has [[blonde hair]] done in a [[short ponytail]] and [[blue eyes]]. He wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[bass clef]] print and [[necktie]]. He wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a white [[headset]].

His counterpart is Kagamine Rin. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.

h4. Appearance

* !post #164844: VOCALOID2 [[kagamine len (act1)|Act1]]

h4. See also

* [[Magical Mirai Len]]

title: kagamine_rin
body:
Kagamine Rin is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the VOCALOID2 engine. She is the second of the Character Vocal Series together with [[Kagamine Len]] and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is voiced by seiyuu, [[Shimoda Asami]]. She is originally designed and illustrated by [[Kei (Keigarou)|KEI]] for her V2 voicebank. Her V4X voicebank follows a similar outfit with readjustments designed and illustrated by [[iXima]].

She has [[blonde hair]] done in a short hair style and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[sailor collar]] shirt with [[treble clef]] print. She wears [[shorts]] along with [[detached sleeves]], [[leg warmers]] and a large [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow]] connected on a white [[headset]].

Her counterpart is [[Kagamine Len]]. Their relationship (whether they are [[siblings]], lovers, etc) is officially left ambiguous and left up to the user to decide.

title: hatsune_miku
body:
Hatsune Miku is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed and distributed by Crypton Future Media, originally released for the VOCALOID2 engine on August 31, 2007. She was the first of the Character Vocal Series and is an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She is recognizable by her [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]] and [[aqua eyes]], although she is commonly depicted with [[blue hair]] and [[blue eyes]]. She wears a [[grey shirt|grey]] or [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[collared shirt]] with an [[aqua necktie|aqua]] or [[blue necktie]], has [[long sleeves|long]] [[black sleeves|black]] [[detached sleeves]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], and [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has a [[number tattoo]] [[shoulder tattoo|on her shoulder]].

She is voiced by [[Fujita Saki]], and her first appearance was illustrated by [[KEI (Keigarou)|]]. 

h4. Appearance

title: hatsune_miku_(blue_archive)
body:
[[Hatsune Miku]] as she appeared in the [[Blue Archive]] [[crossover]] event.

To Miku's signature [[very long hair|very long]] [[aqua hair|aqua]] [[twintails]] is added the requisite [[halo]], which circles the base of her right twintail and resembles the bars of an audio visualizer. Her right twintail also features a large [[white bow]].

Her attire consists of a [[sleeveless shirt|sleeveless]] [[white shirt]] with [[center frills]] and a [[blue sailor collar]]. She also wears a [[double-breasted]], [[high-waist skirt|high-waist]] [[layered skirt]] composed of white over blue striped over straight blue. She has on a pair of simple [[white shoes]] and a [[blue bow|blue]] [[ankle bow]] on her left.

Her weapon is fairly large. It has a compressed [[gas cylinder]] attached and somewhat resembles an oversize bottle rocket.
 
h4. Appearance

* !post #5445086
other_names: 初音ミク(ブルーアーカイブ)

title: converse
body:
Brand of American [[sneakers]] invented in the early 20th-century, most notable for their Chuck Taylor All-Stars series of [[shoes]], which can be featured as [[high tops]], or low tops, and use cross-lacing, and a fabric-like covering.

title: nike_(company)
body:
Nike is a major [[sportswear]] brand. It is the world's leading supplier of [[sneakers]] and apparel and a major manufacturer of sports equipment.

They have recognized trademarks of "Just do it" and the Swoosh logo and are the parent company of [[Air Jordan]] and [[Converse]].

body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Shigure Ui (vtuber)|]]'s VTuber avatar.

It's is the [[summer uniform|summer version]] of her default [[school uniform]], it consists of a [[grey cardigan]], a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt|shirt]], a [[blue bowtie]] a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and [[black shoes|black]] [[loafers]].

Her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this outfit is almost the same as her default outfit, except that she has [[short twintails|short]] [[low twintails]] instead of hair rings and an has an [[ahoge]] now.

title: ranboo_(r800)
body:
An English-speaking [[indie virtual youtuber|Indie]] [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and the current persona of streamer [[Ranboo]]. They are an [[androgynous]] character with a somewhat similar appearance to their real life counterpart.

In lore, they are an [[android]] created by the fictional corporation Rancorp.

They were designed by [[mochiflxwer]].

title: kirishima_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Kirishima[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Touyama Nao]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]], [[green-framed_eyewear|green-framed]] [[glasses]], and [[grey eyes]]. In the anime, the lenses of her glasses have a [[heads-up display]] that shows various information. All of the Kongou-class wear a [[nontraditional miko|modified miko]] uniform with differently colored [[skirt|skirts]] (hers is [[black skirt|black]]), [[thigh boots]], and wear the same signature winged [[hairband]].

Sometimes seen holding a [[microphone]] due to her doing a mic check in her intro as well as in her hourlies.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2082901: Base and kai
* !post #2082925: [[kirishima kai ni (kancolle)|Kai Ni]]

title: samuel_b._roberts_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the American [i]John C. Butler[/i]-class destroyer escort as depicted in [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i].

As a destroyer escort, she is of a small frame comparable to an elementary schooler. Her [[short hair]] is a dull light [[blue hair]] done up in [[double bun|double buns]] while her eyes are a highly light, dull [[yellow eyes|yellow]].

Her wardrobe consists of a [[sleeve cuffs|cuffed]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white shirt|white]] [[serafuku]] with a [[blue sailor collar]] (oversized to fit her collar rigging) and [[aqua neckerchief]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[aqua skirt|aqua]] [[miniskirt]], a [[white headwear|white]] [[dixie cup hat]] with a [[black ribbon|black]] [[hat ribbon|ribbon]] and star ornament (representing the Battle Star she earned for Samar) attached to it, [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[red footwear|red shoes]] with [[rudder footwear|attached rudders]] and screws, and a [[thigh strap]] on her left leg. The [[signal flag]]s on the ends of her hat ribbon spell out her radio callsign, NTIK. 

In her right hand, she is holding one of her 5-inch gun turrets in an [[adapted turret|adapted]] assembly that resembles a [[P90]] [[submachine gun]]. The assembly has a length of armor plating attached to the side, which holds at least 2 spare magazines.

The [[Navy Cross]] hanging from her left shoulder references both the one awarded posthumously to her namesake, "Coxswain Samuel Booker Roberts Jr.":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_B._Roberts], and the one awarded to her skipper, "Lieutenant Commander Robert W. Copeland":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_W._Copeland], for the action off Samar.

She is accompanied by a [[little blue whale (kancolle)|]]. This references another incident of the historical [i]Samuel B. Roberts[/i]: on her first day of active service, she struck a large whale with her starboard propeller shaft off the coast of Maine, and had to return to Norfolk for repairs. (The species of whale was not recorded.)

Zeco once remarked that shipgirl Samuel [[no panties|does not have underwear underneath her clothes]]. It is not known whether it was just a joke as it has never been apparent on official art. Nonetheless, fans took this as semi-fact to the point of being a running gag used by some fan artists. 

h4. Appearance

title: arabesque_(pose)
body:
A common position in [[ballet]] in which the dancer [[standing on one leg|stands on one leg]] (the [i]supporting[/i] leg) with the other leg (the [i]working[/i] leg) [[leg up|elevated]] and extended behind the body, and both legs held straight. If the working leg is bent, the pose may be an [[attitude (pose)|]] instead. 

An arabesque can be executed with the supporting leg [[en pointe]], demi pointe, or with foot flat on the floor. The elevation angles of the working leg is commonly around 45° and 90°, but higher or lower is allowed, and the leg can be raised as high as 180° (in which case the [[standing split]] tag should also be added). 
The arms may be held in various positions, usually [[spread arms]] or one [[arm up]]. 

h4.Examples 
* !post #6111706
* !post #5281847
* !post #5622707: (The girl)

h4.See also

[[Retire_(ballet)|]] 
[[Attitude_(pose)|]]

h4.External links

body: The Prophecy Majik's human host. Can be distinguished from her Majik-possessed self by her lack of [[heterochromia]] and [[hair ornament]]s (or her [[closed eyes]], as her true eye color is unknown), and by the dresses she wears, as the Majik prefers either a [[jester costume]] or [[pajamas]].

title: a-chan_(hololive)
body:
[b]Yuujin A[/b] (lit. "Friend A"), better known as [b]A-chan[/b] (Ei-chan), is a former (as of "the end of June 2024":[https://twitter.com/achan_UGA/status/1806583319725039822]) [[hololive]] staff member and director.

She has [[aqua eyes|aqua]] or [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] with [[swept bangs]], a large [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]], and [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]].

Despite not officially being a [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]] herself, she is a popular character in the hololive fandom, which reached the point that she eventually gained her own VTuber model (designed by [[Amagai Tarou]]). She used it to host various collab and announcement streams on the main hololive YouTube channel.

Her name refers to her status as a personal friend of [[Tokino Sora]], though she had never been a manager of her or any other hololive member.

Going for a proper talent manager theme, her second costume consists of a [[black shirt|black]] and [[grey shirt|grey]] [[vertical-striped shirt]], [[black jacket]], black [[sash]], [[grey pants]], [[black footwear|black shoes]], and an [[ID card]] with a hololive [[lanyard]].

title: johnston_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the USS [I]Johnston[/i] (hull number DD-557), 75th of the US Navy's 175 Fletcher-class destroyers. She's voiced by "Shiraki Nao":https://myanimelist.net/people/42439 and was designed by [[Zeco]]. Her namesake is "Navy Lieutenant John V. Johnston":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_V._Johnston], who fought for the Union from 1862 to 1864 during the [[American Civil War]]. She is the game's first bona fide American destroyer, despite the fact that destroyer escort [i][[Samuel B. Roberts (Kancolle)|]][/i] was already classified as a destroyer in the game.

Compared to [[Samuel B. Roberts (Kancolle)|]], Johnston is much taller and [[medium_breasts|slightly more well-endowed]] with [[long_hair|long]] pinkish [[light brown hair]] tied into a [[two side up]] style and [[brown eyes]].

She wears a stylized [[serafuku]] which consists of an [[off shoulder|off-shoulder]] [[blue shirt]] with a black [[sailor collar]] that exposes her [[cleavage]] and short [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], along with [[black thighhighs]] held by [[garter straps]] with what seem to be metallic thigh and [[shin guards]] and red [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. Johnston's damaged CG has her stripped of some of her clothing, revealing a bit of her black underwear.

On her left hand she wears a [[single glove|single]] [[black gloves|black glove]], an oblique reference to the injuries to the left hand sustained by her captain, "Commander Ernest E. Evans":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ernest_E._Evans], including losing two fingers. Draped on her left upper arm is the [[United States Medal of Honor|Medal of Honor]], referencing the one posthumously awarded to Commander Evans for his actions in the "Battle off Samar":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_off_Samar].

Her [[rigging]] consists of two [[smokestack]]s and three of her Mark 12 5-inch/38 caliber [[cannon|gun]] [[ship turret|turret]]s, with one set on each side of her rigging and a third [[adapted turret|handheld turret]] in her right hand. Her hull number is emblazoned on each side of her lower rigs.

h4. Appearance

title: xebec
body:
Japanese animation studio. Originally owned by [[Production IG]], XEBEC was often considered a rival to [[Sunrise (company)|]] for their output of [[science fiction]] and [[mecha]] series.

In 2019, the studio was acquired by [[sunrise_(company)|Sunrise]] and ceased operations. Its address and remaining assets were reorganized into a new studio called [b]Sunrise Beyond[/b], with their first production after the acquisition being [[Gundam Build Divers Re:Rise]]. The rights to their previous productions remained with Production IG.

title: triangular_headpiece
body:
A type of headband sometimes worn by [[ghost]]s in Japanese folklore.

Derived from Edo period burial rituals, it was originally intended to protect the newly deceased from evil spirits. It has various regional names—[i]hitai-eboshi[/i] (額烏帽子, lit. "forehead headpiece"), [i]tenkan[/i] (天冠), [i]houkan[/i] ("diadem", only Buddhists use this word), [i]kami-kaburi[/i], [i]kami-kakushi[/i] (髪隠し, lit. "hair-hider"), zukin (頭巾, lit. "hood" and also used as a generic term), and so on.

The triangle cloth on the head of Japanese ghosts, known as a tenkan or hitaikakushi, is a piece of traditional funeral attire that serves as part of a white kimono and signals the deceased's status and transition into the spiritual world. While the exact meaning is debated, theories suggest it is a symbol of ascendance to a higher plane, a protective "heaven's crown," or a ward to prevent evil from entering the body, which is why it is found on ghosts like the yūrei

h4. See also 
* [[right-over-left kimono]]

title: cat_eye-framed_eyewear
body:
[[Glasses]] with an upswept rim at the outer edges where the temples or arms join the frame front. Cat-eye glasses were popular in the 1950s and 1960s among women.  

They are somewhat teardrop shaped, but do not confuse this with [[teardrop-framed glasses]]. They are rounded towards the nose, and pointed at the eyewear's legs. They are somewhere between [[round eyewear]] and [[triangular eyewear]].

title: shirttail
body:
The shirttail (also spelled "shirt-tail") is the bottom part of a shirt (especially a [[dress shirt]] or [[collared shirt]]) that would normally be tucked below the waist of the lower garment. This becomes visible if the shirt is [[untucked_shirt|untucked]], or if the lower garment is [[no pants|missing]], [[skirt lift|lifted]] or [[upskirt|seen from below]] at a low angle (for [[skirt]]s particularly in the latter two examples).

h4. See also

* [[dress shirt]]
* [[collared shirt]]
* [[whale tail (clothing)]]: A tangentially similar case where the underwear is visible above the waistline instead of the shirt visible below it.

title: chang'e
body:
The Chinese goddess who lives on the [[moon]] in [[Chinese mythology]]. Her husband is [[Hou Yi]], a legendary archer.

According to Chinese myth, Yi once shot down nine of the ten suns and saved all people on the earth. But his solution invoked divine wrath and they lost their immortality. Yi managed to get an elixir of life from [[Xi Wangmu]], a Chinese goddess. However, instead of sharing the elixir with him to become immortal again, Chang'e swallowed the entire pill and ascended magically to the moon. Unfortunately, she was not able to reach the celestial world. The reason varies according to several variations of the story. In the most popular version she tried not to be robbed of the elixir by [i]Feng Meng[/i], Yi's evil pupil. In any case, she is suffering from loneliness even now. She has a [[moon rabbit]], called 玉兎 ([i]Yutu[/i], lit. Jade rabbit), making the elixir or various herbal medicines on the moon.

After her ascension, Yi took the food liked by Chang'e to an altar and offered it as a sacrifice for her. The legend is regarded as the origins of the mid autumn celebration.

In the [[Touhou]] series, Chang'e is kept prisoner in the Lunar Capital. In [[Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom]] it is revealed that [[Junko_(touhou)|]], Houyi's original wife, has a grudge against her.

h4. See also

* [[moon rabbit]]
* [[mooncake]]
* [[Wu Gang]] - the [[lumberjack|woodcutter]] living on the moon.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chang'e":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chang%27e

title: american_psycho
body:
A black comedy-horror novel by writer Bret Easton Ellis, published in 1991. It was adapted into a 2000 film starring [[Christian Bale]].

It is a satirical psychological thriller that delves into the disturbing mind of [[Patrick Bateman]]. The story is set in the 1980s during the height of the yuppie culture in [[New York City]]. It follows Patrick Bateman, a wealthy investment banker, as he navigates his high-powered job, materialistic lifestyle, and his double life where he engages in supposed acts of extreme violence, murder and sadism. 

The film was considered a box-office disappointment but has since developed a large cult following. The film experienced a revival of popular interest in the 2020s due to its strong presence in contemporary meme culture, typically centered around Bateman's perceived "sigma" personality. 

h4. See also

* [[American Psycho sex scene (meme)]]
* [[Patrick Bateman]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: American Psycho":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho]
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film)]

title: fengguan
body:
A type of traditional Chinese headwear for women. It was worn mainly by noblewomen during the Ming Dynasty for ceremonies or official occasions; it is also worn by brides during weddings.

The are several different variations of the fengguan's design, so the design can vary greatly. Traditionally, the number of dragons, pheasants and phoenixes on the hat denoted the wearer's rank.

Fengguan means "phoenix crown", a name that originates from its adornments: phoenixes made of inlaid kingfisher feathers, as well as gold dragons, beaded pheasants, pearls and other gemstones. Sometimes they are adorned with decorative wings - called diyi - instead of beads. 

h4. See also

* [[Chinese clothes]]
* [[Tag group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fengguan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fengguan

title: daicon_iv
body:
An animated short produced by the [[Daicon]] Film group for the 22nd Annual Japan National SF Convention, [b]Daicon IV[/b], in 1983. 

The short they produced for this convention started with a recap of the original short [[Daicon III]] and continued the adventures of the protagonist, who now becomes the [[Daicon Bunny Girl]]. The quality of the animation in this short clip was much higher and more impressive than that of the previous film.

The action was set to the song "Twilight" from the band [i]Electric Light Orchestra[/i]. The use of this song, however, was unlicensed, preventing the short from being officially released on DVD, making the limited laserdisc release of the Daicon shorts very rare and highly sought after.

This short firmly established Daicon Film as a talented new anime studio. The studio changed its name to [[Gainax]] two years later.

h4. See also

* [[Daicon 33]]

h4. External links

* "Youtube: DAICON IV Opening Animation":[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-840keiiFDE]

title: daicon_bunny_girl
body:
A female character in a [[playboy bunny]] suit who appeared in the famous opening for [[Daicon IV]]. A younger version of the character known as [[Daicon Girl]] appears in the opening for [[Daicon III]].

Homages to the character and animation can be seen in [[FLCL]] and the opening to [[Densha Otoko]].

title: shinken!!
body:

title: fairey_barracuda
body:
A carrier-borne torpedo [[bomber]] and [[dive bomber]] used by the [[Royal Navy]]'s Fleet Air Arm during [[World War II]].

The aircraft is known for its high-wing style and its flaw of spraying leaking hydraulic fluid containing ether into the pilot's face (in old documents this flaw is erroneously described as carbon monoxide leaking from the engine).

h4. See also

* [[Fairey Swordfish]]
* [[Fairey Albacore]]
* [[List of airplanes]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Fairey Barracuda":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fairey_Barracuda]

title: kono_naka_ni_hitori_imouto_ga_iru!
body:
この中に1人、妹がいる!, lit. [i]One of Them Is My Younger Sister![/i], abbreviated as [i]NakaImo[/i] (中妹, なかいも)

A 2010-2013 light novel series by Taguchi Hajime, with illustrations by [[CUTEG]], published by Media Factory's MF Bunko J imprint. Also adapted into 2011-current manga, [i]Kono Naka ni Hitori, Imouto ga Iru! - Who is "IMOUTO"?[/i] by Mottun*, serialized in in Media Factory's [i]Monthly Comic Alive[/i], and a Summer 2012 anime by Studio Gokumi.

title: that's_what_i_like_(bruno_mars)
body:
[b]That's What I Like[/b] is a song by American singer-songwriter [[Bruno Mars]] from his third studio album [i]24K Magic[/i] (2016). 

It is a R&B and pop song that talks about the finer things in life that Mars enjoys and is willing to provide for a special someone. The lyrics highlight various luxuries and pleasures, including jewelry, trips, designer brands, and other extravagant experiences. 

It stands as the highest-charting single in the [[United States]] from the album. The song was the world's fourth-best-selling digital single of 2017, with 9.7 million units, ranking among the best-selling singles worldwide.

h4. See also

* [[The Lazy Song (Bruno Mars)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: That's What I Like (Bruno Mars)":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/That%27s_What_I_Like_(Bruno_Mars_song)

title: the_lazy_song_(bruno_mars)
body:
[b]The Lazy Song[/b] is a song by American singer-songwriter [[Bruno Mars]] from his debut studio album [i]Doo-Wops & Hooligans[/i] (2010). 

It is a lighthearted and humorous track that talks about taking a day off from work or responsibilities to just relax and do nothing. The song's lyrics are about Mars' desire to be lazy, stay in bed, and avoid any obligations, simply enjoying a day of leisure.

h4. See also

* [[That's What I Like (Bruno Mars)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The Lazy Song":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lazy_Songe

title: kuso_atsui_(meme)
body:
Lit: [i]It's so fucking hot![/i]

A quote from a Canadian woman who appeared in "ABC's":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asahi_Broadcasting_Corporation "Tantei! Knight Scoop":http://www.asahi.co.jp/knight-scoop/] in 2004. The show aired a segment in which foreigners got into a bathtub containing very hot water, whereupon the Canadian woman exclaimed "It's so fucking hot!" and jumped out.

It became a reaction image for hot weather among [[Futaba Channel]] users in the late 2000s. In 2013, it went viral on Twitter.

h4. Examples

* !asset #32347749

h4. See also

* [[Special feeling (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Fuckin' Hot (Kuso Atsui)":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/fuckin-hot-kuso-atsui
other_names: ファッキンホット(くそ熱い)

title: special_feeling_(meme)
body:
恋人といる時の雪って [b]特別な気分[/b]に浸れて僕は好きです
[i]"When it snows when you're with your lover, you can immerse yourself in a [b]special feeling[/b]... I like it."[/i]

A [[meme]] parodying a Japanese couple who were interviewed on TV during a snowstorm in Tokyo in the Kantou and Touhoku regions in winter of 2013. When asked about the weather conditions, the boyfriend started rambling about his girlfriend instead, causing her to hide her face in embarrassment. The boyfriend became the target of haters online and spawned many memes.

On February 8, 2014 (when another heavy snowfall came), "a person tweeted":http://twitter.com/rotomx/status/431983568676335618/photo/1 that screenshot and it became a meme.

h4. Examples

* !asset #32347312: Origin

h4. See also

* [[Kuso atsui (meme)]]
* [[Super-cozy (meme)]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Special Feeling / 特別な気分":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/special-feeling-特別な気分
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/5199043
other_names: 恋人といる時の雪って
恋人といる時の雪って特別な気分に浸れて僕は好きです

title: girl_staring_at_guy's_chest_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originally featuring a girl staring at a man's pectoral muscle, seeming impressed by its size.

The image became a popular template among the [[bara]] community, in which the format is switched into two [[muscular male|muscular men]], with one looking at the other's large pectoral muscle, either in [[muscle envy|envy]] or in [[muscle awe|awe]]. Also occasionally used in a similar manner with female [[breast envy]] memes.

h4. See also

* [[looking at breasts]]
* [[looking at pectorals]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Girl staring at guy's chest":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/girl-staring-at-guys-chest]

title: succubus_stayed_life
body:
Succubus Stayed Life ("Life with a Succubus") is an erotic doujin manga by [[Sasamori Tomoe]].

The male protagonist meets the self-proclaimed "succubus", [[Sakuramachi Touko]], and they eventually get into a sex friend relationship. But soon, both the protagonists childhood friend, [[Yomisawa Tsukino]], as well as [[Sakuramachi Touko|Touko's]] "succubus" friend, [[Akizono Kanna]], appears...

Adapted into an adult light novel by Honjou Yagi in 2017.

h4. Characters

* [[Sakuramachi Touko]]
* [[Yomisawa Tsukino]]
* [[Akizono Kanna]]
other_names: サキュバステードライフ

title: kasane_teto
body:
An [[UTAU]] character. She is a young girl with [[red eyes]] and [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]]. She typically wears a dark blue/gray outfit with red trim. Her official profile lists her as a "chimera", so she is sometimes given characteristics like a forked tail or wings. Her character item is a [[baguette]]. 

She was created as an April Fools joke by the VIPPERs of 2ch, meant to trick Nico-Nico Douga users into thinking she was the 3rd Vocaloid from Crypton. After the joke was over, instead of fading into obscurity Teto was picked up by [[UTAU]], a freeware knock-off of [[VOCALOID]]. She has maintained a level of popularity, and many have tried to replicate this effect with other joke and fanmade characters since.

After her 15th anniversary on April 2023, she received an [[kasane teto (sv)|updated voicebank]] under the [[Synthesizer V]] engine, which would boost her popularity even further.

Her voice provider is [[Oyamano Mayo]]. Oyamano initially used the name Oyama Nobuyo as a reference to famed singer and voice actress [[Ooyama Nobuyo]]. Since the latter is most known as the voice of [[Doraemon (character)|]], fans had Teto share similar traits. Teto's [[catchphrase]] 君は実に馬鹿だな ("You really are an idiot, aren't you?") also originated from a [[Doraemon]] comic.

Do not tag Kasane Teto as a [[VOCALOID]]. She is either an UTAU, SynthV or [[VOICEPEAK]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #3853931: [[Kasane Teto (UTAU)|UTAU]]
* !post #6195000: [[Kasane Teto (SV)|SynthV]]
* !post #9082465: [[Kasane Teto (Voicepeak)|VOICEPEAK]]

h4. See also

* [[UTAU]]
* [[Kasane Teto (UTAU)]]
* [[Kasane Teto (SV)]]
* [[Kasane Teto (VOICEPEAK)]]
* [[Kasane Teto (M.S.J.)]]
* [[Kasane Ted]]
* [[Pearto]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia (JP): 重音テト":https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/重音テト
* "UTAU Wiki: Teto Kasane":http://utau.wikia.com/wiki/Teto_Kasane

title: kasane_teto_(sv)
body:
[[utau|UTAUloid]] [[Kasane Teto]]'s updated voicebank under the [[Synthesizer V]] engine, announced after her 15th anniversary in April 2023. Her design for this voicebank was illustrated by [[Sakauchi Waka]].

Along with her usual [[red hair|red]] [[twin drills]], her hair sports a [[white bow]] on her left drill. She wears a uniform consisting of a [[double-breasted]] [[grey jacket]] with [[shoulder boards]] and [[shoulder belt]], and a [[grey skirt]]. Both have a [[red trim]] and [[striped|stripes]] resembling [[musical staff|music staff]]. She wears [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots]].

title: raiden_punching_armstrong_(meme)
body:
A [[quick time event]] from the 2013 video game [[Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance]] in which the protagonist [[Raiden (metal_gear)|]] [[rapid_punches|rapidly punches]] the main villain Senator [[Steven Armstrong]] in the stomach to no effect.

The scene, often combined from the song "It Has to Be This Way":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N72U-NFu44k (better known by its first lyric "Standing Here I Realize") from the game's soundtrack, has been used as source material for image macros, video captions, GIF captions and remakes. Note that the song doesn't play in this part but rather the final phase in actual gameplay.

h4. See also

* [[Armstrong Incoming (meme)|]]
* [[Nanomachines son! (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Raiden Punching Armstrong / Standing Here I Realize":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/raiden-punching-armstrong-standing-here-i-realize

title: oda_nobunaga
body:
Oda Nobunaga (23 June 1534 – 21 June 1582) was a historical figure of the Sengoku period of feudal Japan, and one of the three main figures who united Japan into a single nation (the others being [[Toyotomi Hideyoshi]] and [[Tokugawa Ieyasu]]).

h4. Series featuring Oda Nobunaga

title: miku_day
body:
Works created to celebrate [[Vocaloid]] [[Hatsune Miku]] on March 9th (3/9), also known as Miku Day. Often includes a reference to the [[dated|date]] somewhere in the image.

The number [[39]] is a [[number pun]] on both "Thank You" and "Miku" in Japanese.

This tag was previously named MikuPa in reference to "Hatsune [b]Miku[/b]'s Live [b]Pa[/b]rty", a yearly event held on 3/9 from 2011 to 2013 where [[SEGA]] and its affiliates put on a giant concert in Tokyo starring Miku.

title: arch_linux
body:
An independently developed, x86-64 general-purpose [[Linux]] distribution. It targets competent GNU/Linux users who desire a high degree of control over their operating system.

Arch uses a rolling-release model, offering continuous updates for all packages, including the kernel and system libraries. Unlike traditional fixed-release distributions that need major upgrades, Arch starts with a minimal base system, allowing users to customize and install only the components they need. This approach provides flexibility and control but requires a deeper understanding of Linux.

h4. See also

* [[Linux]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":[https://archlinux.org/]
* "Wikipedia: Arch Linux":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arch_Linux]

title: bat_clock
body:
It is one of the Ghost Gadgets used by [[Kamen Rider Ghost]].

h4. Forms
h5. Animal mode
* !post #9946287: The Bat Clock Animal mode is depicted in the upper-right panel of this.
This is the [[bat (animal)|]]-type autonomous mecha form.
In this form, it flies through the air, attacking enemies with special sonic waves and sharp wings, or conducting reconnaissance.

h5. Gadget mode
This is the [[clock]] form.
By setting the clock hands to any given time, it can project a stereoscopic image of the events that occurred at that time.

h5. Gun mode
* !post #2268055
This is the [[handgun]] form.
It can fire energy bullets from two muzzles.
By attaching it to the muzzle of the [[Gan Gun Saber]] Gun mode, it can be transformed into the Gan Gun Saber Rifle mode.
* !post #2382438: The Gan Gun Saber Rifle mode is depicted in the lower right corner of this image.

title: handgun
body:
A short-barrelled [[gun|firearm]] designed to be used with one hand or [[two-handed|two hands]] and for shooting at short-ranged targets, while be more concealable to be [[holstered]] than a [[rifle]] or a [[submachine gun]]. Its [[ammunition]] feeding mechanism may vary by design, such as muzzle-loading earlier handguns, [[break action]], by using [[clip (weapon)|clips]] or more commonly [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]].

Handgun types include modern semi-automatic pistols, [[revolver]]s, [[antique firearm]]s such as [[flintlock]]s and [[derringer]]s. This tag also covers the "machine pistol", a handgun capable of fully automatic fire (e.g. [[Beretta 93R]]).

The term "pistol" refers to handguns with a single, stationary (non-revolving) chamber.  In Danbooru, the "pistol" tag redirects to the "handgun" tag.

For the hand gesture imitating a gun, use [[finger gun]] instead.

For the gun barrel fingers, use [[finger cannon]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6736099: Semi-automatic handgun
* !post #6229047: [[Revolver]]

h4. See also

* [[dual wielding]]
* [[flare gun]]
* [[locked slide]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Handgun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handgun]

She's a [[blue eyes|blue eyed]], [[large breasts|large breasted]] girl with [[long hair|long]] [[light purple hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and a [[braid]], held with a [[blue bow|blue]] [[hair bow]]. She wears a [[cropped shirt|cropped]] [[sleeveless shirt]], usually showing her [[underboob]] which she [[clothes pull|pulls]] because she can't handle her [[sweat|sweating]]. She wears [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[two-tone gloves|two-tone]] [[blue gloves|blue]]/[[black gloves]]. She wears [[white pants]], a [[belt]] with a [[belt pouch]] and a [[buckle]]. Wears [[white shoes|white]]/[[blue shoes]]. Usually seen holding a [[bladeless fan]] and [[mouth hold|mouth holding]] [[popsicle]].

title: bailu_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A playable character in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]. Voiced by [[Katou Emiri]] in Japanese. 

She is portrayed with [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]] with [[antenna hair|two ahoge]] and tied into [[twin braids]], [[green eyes]], [[pointy ears]], and [[eastern dragon horns]] and [[eastern dragon tail|tail]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]] worn under a [[white coat|white]] [[wave print]] [[duijin ruqun]] with [[detached sleeves]] and [[fur trim]], a [[gourd]] to her left, [[blue socks]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]]. 

Her race is the [[dragon girl|Vidyadhara]], and serves as its current High Elder. 

h4. Appearance
* !post #7691280: Splash art
* !post #8768102: Time Waits for No One (signature Light Cone)

h4. Profile
[expand]
A vivacious young lady of the Vidyadhara race, she is known as the "Healer Lady" due to her expertise with medicine.

She often dishes out unorthodox prescriptions such as "Stay well hydrated" and "Get a good night's rest."

Bailu cannot bear to see people suffer, and that's why you'll see her with her eyes shut tightly as she cures ailments.

"As long as they're cured, that's all that matters, right?"
[/expand]

h4. See also
* [[Baiheng (honkai: star rail)|]]

title: kinich_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable character from [[Genshin Impact]], he is a saurian hunter from the Scions of the Canopy tribe in Natlan who is commonly depicted with his companion [[Ajaw (genshin impact)|]]. Kinich is one of the Six Heroes of Natlan, bearing the ancient name [b]Malipo[/b], meaning Turnfire.

Very skilled with his abilities, he accepts commissions no one else wants and is equally skilled at appraising the price. Kinich appears cold, reserved and to-the-point, which discourages people from getting close to him, though he is friends with [[Mualani (genshin impact)|]] and [[Kachina (genshin impact)|]]. [spoiler]Kinich first discovered Ajaw in some [[ruins]] and realized he would be a threat if not controlled. Over the course of several days, the two negotiated. Ajaw, wanting to leave and see the outside world eventually agreed, under the condition that the dragonlord gets Kinich's body once he dies. In return, Ajaw became his companion and would lend him some of his power.[/spoiler]

Kinich has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[green hair|green]] and [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[antenna hair]], [[crossed bangs]] [[hair between eyes|between his eyes]] and [[green eyes|green]] and [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[two-tone eyes]]. He wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[black shirt]], [[blue pants|blue]] and [[aqua pants]] with an [[aqua coat]] around [[clothes around waist|his waist]], multiple [[black ribbon]]s, [[black gloves]], a [[bracelet]] on each arm and a pair of [[black boots]]. He has large white [[earrings]], [[spiked ear piercing]]s, a [[green headband]] and multiple [[tattoo]]s on his [[arm tattoo|arms]] and [[neck tattoo|neck]]. He wears his [[vision (genshin impact)|]] on his right leg. His [[vision (genshin impact)|]] element is Dendro and he wields a [[greatsword|claymore]] in battle.

His signature weapon is [[Fang of the Mountain King (genshin impact)|]].

Voiced by Jacob Takanashi in English (replacing John Patneaude (v5.0-v5.5)), [[Sugiyama Noriaki]] in Japanese and Banma in Chinese.

h4. Appearance

* !post #7858754: Default
* !asset #30509194: [[Kinich (Hot Springs) (genshin impact)|Hot Springs]]

h4. See also

* [[Ajaw (Genshin Impact)|]]
* [[List of Genshin Impact characters]]

h4. External links

* "Genshin Impact Wiki: Kinich":https://genshin-impact.fandom.com/wiki/Kinich

body:
A creature in [[Genshin Impact]].

A special form of the kuuhenki spirits that reside in Nod-Krai, born from blessings of the Moon Goddess.

A Luonnotar is light blue in color, small, and freely floats in the air. It has two long ears, very long wings that drape to its sides, and two arms it keeps folded in front of itself. It has two perpetually [[closed eyes]], and a crescent-shaped [[forehead mark]].

HEARTSTEEL is a group of unapologetic enthusiasts dedicated to creative expression and uncompromising individuality. Their goal is to forge a path of success no matter what the cost. title: mr_big_(snk)
body:
A villain in [[SNK]]'s [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] and [[The King of Fighters]] series of video games.

The original boss of the South Town underworld, before a young [[Geese Howard]] swooped in and took over. Mr. Big was the mastermind behind the kidnapping of [[Yuri Sakazaki]] in AoF. After [[Ryou Sakazaki|Ryo Sakazaki]] and [[Robert Garcia]] ran Geese out of town, Mr. Big disappeared for a time, with no love lost for Geese. In [[Fatal Fury: City of the Wolves]], twelve years after Geese's death by [[Terry Bogard]], Mr. Big returns to reassert himself as the OG of South Town. He secretly worked as part of a collaboration with [[Billy Kane]] and [[Kain R Heinlein|Kain R. Heinlein]] to protect Marie Heinlein, sister of Kain and mother of Geese's bastard son [[Rock Howard]].

In the original Japanese story of Art of Fighting 2, it's explained that Mr. Big is a rival of Geese within the same criminal syndicate who are both vying for control. In an attempt to thwart Geese maneuvers to gain more power, he kidnaps Yuri to manipulate [[Takuma Sakazaki]] under his command and prevent Geese from recruiting him. In the English localization and Japanese [[Super Nintendo]] retelling of the events, however, Mr. Big is instead begrudgingly serving under Geese's as his second in command, and it was Geese himself who masterminded the kidnapping of Yuri and ultimately gained Takuma under his control.

In the King of Fighters continuity, Mr. Big again served as Geese's lackey before eventually turning on him, and he and Geese are in the midst of a gang war in South Town.

title: red_prison_magic_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] of the magic school in the Crimson Demon Village attended by [[Megumin]] from [[kono_subarashii_sekai_ni_shukufuku_wo!|Konosuba]] and her classmates.  It appears prominently in the prequel spinoff [[Kono Subarashii Sekai ni Bakuen wo!]].

It consists of a [[short dress|short]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[dress]] with [[long sleeves]] and a brown hem, a [[red_necktie|red]] and [[orange_necktie|orange]] [[diagonal-striped_necktie|diagonally-striped]] [[necktie]], a long [[black_cloak|black]] [[cloak]] with [[wide sleeves]], a [[red_cloak|red]] [[two-sided_fabric|lining]], and a wide yellow neckline that is usually worn [[off shoulder]], and clipped with a [[brooch]]. The legwear and footwear appear to be up to the student's discretion, but legwear is always black and footwear is always [[brown_footwear|brown]].

This tag is for the Inklings that serve as the player's character, and for squid form Inklings (post #2028621). Do not use it for named characters such as [[Callie_(splatoon)|]] or [[Marie_(splatoon)|]].

body:

The title means something like an urgent feeling of dizziness or vertigo (きゅう - urgent, くらり - feeling of dizziness). Another potential reading could be a sudden and swift change in everything (きゅう - sudden, くらり - situation in which there is a sudden and large change in things).

title: fall_guys
body:
A platformer battle royale game developed by Mediatonic and published by Devolver Digital, released for PC and [[PlayStation 4]] in 2020. It quickly became one of the most talked about games of the year, partially due to its popularity among streamers and [[virtual youtuber]]s. title: i've_never_seen_a_guy_recreate_this_successfully_tbh_(meme)
body:
A meme  focusing on characters, often men, trying on and being unable to wear [[undersized clothes|undersized]] [[open pants|pants]] because of the size of their [[ass]] and [[bulge]]. The meme  sprung out from a Tweet by Vessyteena captioned "I've never seen a guy recreate this successfully tbh":[/media_assets/8329126] with a cropped version of [[suko mugi]]'s [[Hypnosis Mic]] comic (post #6149751) , which depicts [[Busujima Mason Rio]] doing the same in a fitting room.

The tweet picked up steam within the fandom and the BL and [[bara]] communities, with imitators dropping the fitting room context and sometimes adding [[motion lines]] like  in the original comic. Variations of the meme will often have the characters be drawn as [[topless male|topless]], unlike the original which kept Busujima fully clothed.

h4. Examples

* !post #6149751: Origin
* !post #6153730
* !post #6190550

h4. See also

* [[shampoo challenge]]

h4. External links

* "Twitter: Original Tweet":https://twitter.com/Vessyteena/status/1635675730129588229

title: sukajan
body:
A [[jacket]] in the style of a [[bomber jacket]] or [[letterman jacket]] with [[embroidery]] on the back and chest, often of fancy eastern-themed designs such as [[eastern dragon]]s, [[tiger]]s, [[cherry blossoms]], etc.

The sukajan has its origins in post-[[World War II]], where occupying American soldiers in Japan would commemorate their time overseas by ordering custom-made jackets with these oriental designs. For this reason, these jackets are also known as souvenir jackets.

Often seen worn by [[delinquent]]s, the [[yakuza]], or [[band (music)|]] members.

h4. Examples

* !post #4263900

h4. See also

* [[tokkoufuku]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sukajan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukajan

title: liar_x_liar
body: Liar × Liar is a Japanese romantic‑comedy manga by [[Kinda'ichi Renjuurou]]. It ran in Kodansha’s shōjo magazine Dessert from February 24, 2010 to June 24, 2017 and was collected in 10 volumes. The story follows college student [[Takatsuki Minato]], who—after disguising herself as a high‑schooler—ends up dating her own stepbrother Tōru, who doesn’t realize it’s her, kicking off a tangle of lies and a love triangle.

title: notched_ear
body:
A cut in a creature's ear from a past injury. Usually a triangular notch, but can also be a hole or a missing ear tip.

Most commonly seen in feral or outdoor [[cat|cats]], sometimes as a way of marking them as spayed, neutered, and/or vaccinated. It can also be seen in other animals as well, but may also be seen in characters with [[animal ears]].

title: checkered_clothes
body:
Clothing with a checkered pattern, which is a series of uniform, repeating squares that alternate between two colors in a diagonal arrangement. The most popular pairing is black and white, but many other combinations exist.

Not to be confused with [[plaid clothes]] or [[gingham]] clothes.

title: plaid_clothes
body:
Clothing featuring a plaid print. Plaid is a pattern made up of many perpendicular vertical and horizontal lines of two or more colors.

Compared to the uniformity of a [[checkered]] pattern, [[plaid]] features distinct irregularity in the width of its lines, and the colors used may not be divided neatly by said lines.

h4. Examples

* !post #8287423: [[Plaid shirt]]

title: gingham
body:
A type of fabric pattern made of small, even checks formed by crossing stripes of the same width. The stripes are usually colored on a white background, creating a repeating mix of white squares, lighter-colored squares, and darker-colored squares.

Commonly used in [[dress|dresses]] and [[tablecloth|tablecloths]]. The [[Kobeya uniform]] is notable for incorporating a gingham [[apron]].

Not to be confused with [[plaid]], which uses varying stripe widths, nor with [[checkered]], which uses solid squares of alternating colors without mid-toned checks.

h4. Examples

* !post #6795743
* !asset #31448014: Gingham pattern

h4. See also

* [[Paisley]]
* [[Pinstripe pattern]]

title: american_flag
body:
The flag of the [[united states|United States of America]], colloquially known as the [b]Stars and Stripes[/b]. It serves as a symbol of the country's unity, independence, and democratic ideals. 

The design of the American flag consists of 13 horizontal stripes alternating between red and white, representing the original 13 colonies that declared independence from [[united kingdom|British]] rule. In the top left corner, commonly referred to as the canton, there is a blue rectangle containing 50 white, five-pointed stars arranged in nine rows, representing the 50 states of the United States. The design of the flag has evolved over time as new states joined the Union. The current version with 50 stars became official on July 4, 1960, after [[Hawaii]] became the 50th state.

The colors of the American flag also hold symbolic meaning. Red represents valor and bravery, white signifies purity and innocence, and blue represents vigilance, perseverance, and justice.

The American flag is widely recognized and displayed in various contexts, including government buildings, schools, homes, and during public events and holidays such as Independence Day ([[Fourth of July]]). It is treated with respect and reverence, and there are guidelines and protocols for its proper handling, folding, and display.

For images that only show patterns or other symbols representing the United States rather than the flag itself, use the [[United States]] tag. For images of an older American flag with less than 50 stars, also add [[historical American flag]]. 

h4. Examples

* !asset #20076915

h4. See also

* [[American flag print]]
* [[Historical American flag]]
* [[United States]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Flag of the United States":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flag_of_the_United_States]
other_names: アメリカ合衆国の国旗

title: historical_american_flag
body:
Designs of the [[American flag]] that are no longer in use.

As new states are incorporated into the United States, a star is customarily added to the flag. The last time in which this was done was in July 1960 with the admittance of [[Hawaii]] to the US, and the number of stars on the flag was increased to 50. 

This tag is for American flags that have less than 50 stars, due to being from a time before the US had 50 states. This tag does not cover American flags with less than 50 stars due to [[artistic error]] or stylistic representation.

h4. Examples

* !post #613271: [[American Revolution]]-era with 13 stars.
* !post #9042981: [[American Civil War]]-era with 34, 35, or 36 stars (two states were added to the Union during the conflict).
* !post #9794323: [[World War I]] and [[World War II]]-era with 48 stars, lasting from 1912-1959.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Timeline of the flag of the United States":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_the_flag_of_the_United_States

title: jungle_wa_itsumo_hare_nochi_guu
body:
Jungle wa Itsumo Hare nochi Guu (ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ) — often released in English as Haré+Guu — is a surreal gag-comedy series by mangaka [[Kinda'ichi Renjuurou]]. It began as a manga in Monthly Shōnen Gangan and was later adapted into anime.

Haré, a 10‑year‑old boy living with his carefree mom Weda in a modernized jungle village, suddenly has to share his home with Guu—a deadpan, otherworldly “girl” whose bizarre powers (including swallowing people into a strange world inside her) turn Haré’s everyday life into escalating, absurd chaos.
other_names: ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ

title: ginga_eiyuu_densetsu
body:
[b]Ginga Eiyuu Densetsu[/b] (lit. "Legend of the Galactic Heroes", also known as [i]Gin'ei den[/i] or [i]LOTGH[/i]) is a series of science fiction novels written by [[Tanaka Yoshiki]], detailing the conflict between the [[Galactic Empire (gin'eiden)|]] and the [[Free Planets Alliance]].

The series has received multiple adaptations, including an anime that aired from 1988 to 1997, two mangas, and several video games. A new anime adaptation aired in 2018, and a series of films is set to premiere in 2019.

body:
A [b]space elevator[/b] is a proposed type of [[space]] transportation system. Like its name implies, is basically an elevator designed to ascend all the way through the atmosphere and into space.

The system is also referred as the orbital elevator, Jacob's Ladder and Beanstalk in several old [[science fiction]] stories. The related concepts are the [[space fountain]], [[orbital ring]], skyhook, space necklace and rotovator.

title: tomino_yoshiyuki
body:
[b]Tomino Yoshiyuki[/b] (born 富野 喜幸 November 5, 1941) is a notable Japanese [[mecha]] anime story creator and writer, responsible for perhaps making [[gundam|the first real robot anime]]. He created and first introduced the now popular term [[mobile suit]] for that series.

Tomino is also infamous for having some series end with numerous characters dying, earning him the nickname "Kill'em All Tomino"  (皆殺しの富野 [i]Minagoroshi no Tomino[/i]).

He has created or co-created such notable works as the U.C. (Universal Century) [[Gundam]] series that started with [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], [[Zeta Gundam]], [[Gundam ZZ]], [[Victory Gundam]], [[Turn A Gundam]], [[Seisenshi Dunbine]], [[Densetsu Kyojin Ideon]], [[Sentou Mecha Xabungle]], [[Ginga Hyouryuu Vifam]], [[Juusenki L-Gaim]], [[Brain Powered]] and [[Overman King Gainer]] among others. His latest work is [[Gundam G No Reconguista]].

Tomino also writes some of the music for his series under the pseudonym "Iogi Rin":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BA%95%E8%8D%BB%E9%BA%9F], such as King Gainer's catchy opening.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiyuki_Tomino
* Pixiv tag search: "”富野由悠季 (監督 OR 御大)”":http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag&word=%E5%AF%8C%E9%87%8E%E7%94%B1%E6%82%A0%E5%AD%A3%20%28%E7%9B%A3%E7%9D%A3%20OR%20%E5%BE%A1%E5%A4%A7%29

title: michishio_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Michishio[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Miyakawa Wakana]].

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] light [[brown hair]] done [[two side up]] into [[double bun]]s, and [[yellow eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Asashio[/i]-class uniform: a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]], a [[grey skirt]] with [[suspenders]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and grey-red [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and 61 cm quad handheld [[torpedo tubes]].

The historical ship was completed in October 1937 and sunk at Battle of Surigao Strait in October 1944.

h4. Appearance

* !post #2082859: Base

title: unryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Unryuu[/i]. Character designed by [[Kuuro Kuro]], voiced by [[Kawasumi Ayako]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] tied into a long [[braid]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[blue vest|blue]] and [[white vest]] with green trim, [[white skirt|white]] [[miniskirt]] and [[green thighhighs]] along with greaves and [[platform footwear|platform]] [[rudder footwear|rudder shoes]]. Most parts of her clothes have cloud-like patterning as a reference to her name ([i]Cloud Dragon[/i]).

Her [[rigging]] is based off her real-life bridge and platforms with several [[anti-aircraft gun]]s, which can be operated with a built-in trigger, while she uses a [[staff]] for her shikigami aircraft with her real-life [[flight deck]] used as a banner. 

She is a highly calm individual, with degrees of her "coolness" varying in several fan works. Some depict her as stoic and somewhat air-headed, others as very ladylike and quiet, or even almost [[expressionless]] in some cases.

title: saratoga_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the carrier USS [i]Saratoga[/i] (CV-3). Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Itou Shizuka]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied to a [[side ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a buttoned [[white dress]] with [[breast pocket]]s, [[red neckerchief]] and [[anchor]], [[red belt]], [[red thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[white shoes|white]] [[high heels]], and her real-life funnel as a [[hair ornament]] with an emblazoned "E" [[Battle Effectiveness Award]] from her training exercises in 1938.

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[Thompson submachine gun]] [[flight deck]] (though it should not be tagged as a Thompson), her aft flight deck with the "SARA" marking and two 203 mm twin gun mounts, and spare drum [[magazine (weapon)|]]s for a Thompson under her dress and additional box magazines on a garter holster, both emblazoned with the pre-1942 US military aircraft roundel.

title: hyuuga_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Hyuuga[/i]. Character design by [[Shibafu (glock23)|]], voiced by [[Ootsubo Yuka]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] comprising a pale [[white kimono]] top, [[black shirt|black undershirt]], [[brown hakama]] tied around the waist with a [[sash]], [[brown socks]], and [[sandals]]. She always wears a [[katana]] at her side. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel to her back, her real-life bridge on her chest, four (three at kai form) 35.6 cm twin gun mounts, and a [[radar]] and [[flight deck]] replacing one of her gun turrets at kai form. 

The Ise-class are the poster girls of [[KanColle Arcade]], SEGA's card-based arcade adaptation of the browser game.

title: shigure_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The second remodel of [[Shigure_(kancolle)|]].

In her second remodeling, [[hair flaps]] have formed in her hair, and she gains a hair decoration (either salvaged from or based on one of [[Fusou (kancolle)|]]'s or [[Yamashiro (Kancolle)|]]'s) and she wears the same uniform as [[Yuudachi (Kancolle)|]] but with a straight [[necktie]].

Her hair flaps and neck piece are near duplicates of those on [[Yuudachi (Kancolle)|]] (and would become a hallmark for all subsequent Shiratsuyu-class remodels), and because of this the two girls are frequently portrayed together, despite the fact that the real ships shared no common operations. The hair flaps also look much like a dog's floppy ears, and because of this she is (and Yuudachi too) often given doggish mannerisms, despite her in-game personality having no doggish mannerisms.

title: kiyoshimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Kiyoshimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]].

She ha [[very long hair|very long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] outer, [[blue hair|blue]] inner) with a [[single hair bun]] turning into [[low twintails]], an [[ahoge]], a strand of hair passing [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]]; and [[grey eyes]]. 

She wears the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]]: a purple/maroon [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]], [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] and [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] is the same as the rest of the class: her funnel and foremast to her back, a 12.7 cm twin [[handgun]] mount, and two 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

An excitable girl, she wants to become a battleship due to her admiration of the battleship [[musashi (kancolle)|Musashi]]. So, it is not uncommon to draw her with Musashi's (or another battleship's) rigging, if only to collapse under the weight.
