title: aoba_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese heavy cruiser [i]Aoba[/i].

She has [[messy_hair|messy]] [[pink hair]] or [[purple hair]] tied into a [[ponytail]] and held by a [[scrunchie]], and [[blue eyes]]. Her default outfit is a [[white shirt|white]] [[sailor shirt]] with a [[blue sailor collar|blue collar]] and a yellow [[neckerchief]], and blue [[shorts]].  She also wears [[black_thighhighs|black]] [[thighhighs]].  

Her [[rigging]] consists of a pair of 203 mm twin gun mounts carried on a strap like a purse on her right, with a [[flight deck]] on her left.  On her back, she carries a mockup of the real ship's bridge like a backpack.  

In the "supplementary material for the 2016 anime film":[https://twitter.com/tayotayo1224/status/1518217102226001920], Aoba is revealed to have a second remodel/kai ni, but remains unimplemented in-game due to her original artist [[Hatsuko]] no longer in touch with C2 Kikan since 2015. Her kai ni transforms her back rig to her real-life bridge superstructure with a mast, a crane on the left/portside, and a catapult on the right/starboard. Her two 20.3 cm twin mounts are also remounted to a new portable rig similar to [[Kinugasa Kai Ni (Kancolle)|]]. In addition, she also gains a third 20.3 cm twin mount attached to the left side of her shorts. 

The historical Aoba famously had a war correspondent onboard, and as such, Aoba has been made out into being the "reporter shipgirl":[/pools/8444]. At best, this makes her optimistic and enthusiastic, but at worst, she's portrayed as a stalker or paparazzi (whether she's portrayed as one or the other is largely artist- and/or story-dependent).  (In fact, due to the heavy overlap of artists between [[Touhou]] and Kantai Collection, she's oftentimes just drawn by former Touhou artists as [[Shameimaru Aya]] with the serial numbers filed off, due to the shared reporter stereotypes.) 

Historically, [i]IJN Aoba[/i] was the flagship of Cruiser Division 6, which consisted of her sister ship, [i][[Kinugasa (kancolle)|Kinugasa]][/i], as well as [i][[Furutaka (kancolle)|Furutaka]][/i] and [i][[Kako (kancolle)|Kako]][/i]. She served in numerous naval battles like Coral Sea and Leyte Gulf before being sunk in an air raid in Kure in July 1945.

title: warspite_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the battleship HMS [i]Warspite[/i] (03). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] styled in a [[half up braid]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long sleeved]] [[corset]]ed [[white dress|white]] [[off-shoulder dress]] with a [[red ribbon]] in front. She also wears a [[black hairband]] with a [[mini crown]], [[white thighhighs]] held up by [[garter straps]], [[high heels|high heeled]] [[black shoes|black]] [[mary janes]], and a silver [[necklace]]. 

Her [[rigging]] is in the shape of a [[throne]] which she sits on, and contains her real-life crane and two 38 cm twin gun mounts, her real-life mainmast as a [[scepter]], and a [[globus cruciger]]. 

She is often considered the first foreign shipgirl to actually be able to speak her native language properly by fans, unlike those before her (the German and Italian shipgirls, [[iowa (kancolle)|Iowa]], [[kongou (kancolle)|Kongou]] and [[verniy (kancolle)|Verniy]] to an extent) that have been notorious for their [[ranguage]]. She even goes so far as to speak her English lines in a native-sounding, vaguely British accent (largely thanks to her voice actress being born in Australia). Although Warspite speaks with a Western-sounding accent, actual sentences, such as "Sally go!" demonstrate grammar a native speaker would not use.

Warspite behaves in the manner of a sedate, high-class British lady. She is often depicted in fanart alongside fellow English-speakers [[Iowa (kancolle)|]] and [[Kongou (Kancolle)|]]. She has hourly lines talking about Italian ships [[Littorio (kancolle)|]] and [[Roma (kancolle)|]], who she unsuccessfully tried to escort out of Italy following the Italian surrender, and [[Zara (kancolle)|]] and [[Pola (kancolle)|]], who she sank.

The historic HMS [i]Warspite[/i] was the Royal Navy's most decorated battleship, serving in both World War I and II. After a long career, she was scrapped after the end of World War II.

title: bellona_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Bellona[/i] (63). Character design by [[Ohisashiburi]].

She has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] and [[grey eyes]]. Her outfit consists of an [[ascot]], [[brown shirt]], [[white shorts]], red-white [[waist cape]], a [[white jacket]], [[black feathers]] on her jacket serving as a [[single epaulette]], [[black gloves]], and black [[thigh boots]]. She also has a [[sword]] as a melee weapon.

Her [[rigging]] is essentially the same as her sister [[Black Prince (Azur Lane)|]], having all four of her historical 13.3 cm twin DP gun mounts, two each side, as well as two 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] painted red, one on each side.

title: sirius_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [i]Dido[/i]-class light cruiser HMS [i]Sirius[/i]. Character design by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Aoki Ruriko]].

Like other Royal Navy light cruisers, she is a [[maid]], with [[short hair|short]], [[white hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[huge breasts]] accented by her maid outfit.

She is extremely loyal and doting to the [[Commander (Azur Lane)|]] and will address them as "Honorable Master", but is somewhat clumsy and accident-prone. Her primary role, however, is as a bodyguard and she excels at combat as a result; she just does other duties out of her devotion to the Commander. Sirius also displays a barely-hidden lewd side, often offering to service the Commander if the "Special Touch" is used before correcting herself. Because of her physical traits and personality, she rivals [[Belfast (azur lane)|]] in popularity among the Royal Maids.

title: dido_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Dido[/i] (Pennant Number 37), named for the first queen of Carthage according to Greek and Roman legend. Character design by [[Kincora]], voiced by [[Aoki Ruriko]].

Like other Royal Navy light cruisers, she is a [[maid]], with [[white hair]] (though longer and with a more blue-ish tint) and [[purple eyes]]. Her figure is similar to her sister ship, [[Sirius (Azur Lane)|]], with [[large breasts]] that may even outdo her sister's in terms of size. To emphasize this, her maid dress even comes with a [[underboob cutout]]. She is also frequently shown holding a [[character doll]] of Sirius.

title: hermione_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the [[Royal Navy]] light cruiser HMS [i]Hermione[/i] (74). Character design by [[Haori Io]], voiced by [[Taguchi Hiroko]].

Like other Royal Navy light cruisers, she is a [[maid]], with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] tied into [[braid|braids]], and [[yellow eyes]].

Her outfit consists of a [[frilled dress|frilled]] [[black dress]], a black [[showgirl skirt]] with [[fishnets]], black [[thighhighs]], [[high heels]], and a [[maid headdress]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull parts in a design similar to [[Belfast (Azur Lane)|]]'s, but using 13.3 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun|DP mounts]] (two each side), while she conceals her 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] under her skirt.

She has an [[Ancient Egyptian]] theme, with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair|black]] and [[purple hair]], [[animal ears]], [[purple eyes]], [[dark-skinned female|dark skin]], and [[large breasts]]. body:

She has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[pink hair]] and [[pink eyes]] with a black [[hair bow]]. Her default uniform comprises a [[white shirt|white]] [[sleeveless shirt]], black [[corset]], [[black skirt]] with [[gold trim]], [[pantyhose]], single [[thigh strap]] to her right, [[rudder footwear]], and differently-colored [[elbow gloves]]: [[black gloves|black]] on her left and [[white gloves|white]] on her right.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two main parts, each with two 13.3 cm twin DP mounts and 53.3 cm triple [[torpedo tubes]] colored red, held together by a funnel attachment to her back.

title: hiryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Hiryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. As she was initially designed as Souryuu's sister, she shares the same kimono-and-skirt outfit, but with a different color: hers is [[yellow kimono|yellow]] and [[green skirt|green]]. Common attributes are the [[wide sleeves]], [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], [[yugake]], and flight deck apron with her hull identifier "Hi" inscribed. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] to her back and her real-life [[flight deck]] to her left arm.

title: kiso_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light cruiser [i]Kiso[/i]. Character design by [[Ugume]], voiced by [[Sakura Ayane]]. 

She has [[short_hair|short]] [[green hair]], [[blue eyes]], and wears an [[eyepatch]]. Her default outfit, shared with her sisters Kuma and Tama, is composed of a [[white shirt]] with light [[blue sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief]], [[white hat]], [[white skirt]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life bridge and funnels to her back, a 14 cm gun mount on her left, and two 61 cm twin [[torpedo tubes]] strapped to a [[brown belt]]. 

Bears a resemblance to [[Murasa Minamitsu]] on account of her artist having done Touhou arts prior to Kancolle.

title: iowa_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the US Navy battleship USS [i]Iowa[/i] (BB-61). Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], grayish [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]] with visible [[cleavage]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[grey corset]] with her real-life hull number printed on it, [[blue shirt]] tied to the front, [[American flag print]] [[thighhighs]] (red vertical stripes for the right, blue for the left), [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], two-tone grey-blue [[miniskirt]], [[black belt]] with the US Navy emblem, and [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[knee boots]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces containing her three historic three 406 mm/16-inch triple mounts Mk7, one to her left and two to her right. She also carries three of her ten 127 mm twin mounts: one beside the starboard main guns, two to the back of the portside main gun. Her funnel carries searchlights on either side and has two Bofors 40 mm [[anti-aircraft gun]]s below the searchlights. Another Bofors quad mount is atop her third main battery turret, while the second turret has three Oerlikon 20mm mounts on its top. 

Much like [[Kongou (kancolle)|]], Iowa is loud, friendly and energetic. Also like Kongou, she uses English mixed in with her Japanese speech, but her English is so broken and accented many find it incomprehensible.

Her historical counterpart is currently docked in the Port of Los Angeles complex as a museum ship, making her the first ship to appear in the game which wasn't sunk, scuttled, scrapped, or expended as a target. She is also the first Allied ship implemented in the game.

title: samidare_(kancolle)
body:
The personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Samidare[/i] in [[Kantai Collection]]. Character design by [[Amamiya Chiharu]], voiced by [[Taneda Risa]]. 

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blue hair]] with a [[gradient_hair|gradient]] (lighter at the bottom) that notably spirals towards the bottom.  She also has [[swept bangs]] and very large [[blue eyes]]. 

She wears a special [[sleeveless shirt]] version of a [[serafuku]] with a white skirt unique to her and her younger sister, [[suzukaze (kancolle)|Suzukaze]]. She also wears [[elbow gloves]] and [[black thighhighs]] to create a [[zettai ryouiki]]. Her [[rigging]] is basic: one 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] to her back and two 12.7 cm twin gun mounts as [[handgun]]s.

title: souryuu_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Souryuu[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]]. 

She has [[short hair|short]] dark [[blue hair]] tied into [[twintails]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit, fitting of her name ("[[Seiryuu|Azure Dragon]]"), consists of a [[green kimono]] top with [[wide sleeves]], dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt]], dragon horn-themed [[hairclip]]s for her twintails, flight deck apron, [[white socks]], [[rudder footwear|rudder]] [[sandals]], and [[yugake]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[quiver]] with a radio mast to her back, and her real-life [[flight deck]] on her right arm. 

She, along with Hiryuu and [[Unryuu (kancolle)|]], are nicknamed the "fluffy dragons" because of their generally soft and womanly appearance, in part to their considerably large breasts, and the fact that the "-ryuu" in their names translates to "Dragon".

title: houshou_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese light carrier [i]Houshou[/i]. Character design by [[shibafu_(glock23)|Shibafu]], voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]]. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied to a [[ponytail]], [[grey eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[pink kimono]] top, dark [[blue skirt|blue]] [[hakama skirt]], a [[tasuki]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]] patterned off her hull. Her [[rigging]] consists of a [[bow_(weapon)|bow]] and carries a [[quiver]] on her back, plus her real-life [[flight deck]] is attached to her left arm.

As she was the world's first ship designed and built as an aircraft carrier to be completed, she is often depicted as a [[motherly]] character. She is sometimes seen as the proprietress of a bar or a restaurant, stemming from one of [[Chitose (kancolle)|]]'s hourly lines.

title: shoukaku_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Shoukaku[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Nomizu Iori]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]] with a [[hairband]], [[brown eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit is a [[nontraditional miko]] attire comprising a [[white kimono]] top, [[red skirt|red]] [[hakama short skirt]], [[black thighhighs|black]] [[thigh boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder and propeller]] gear, and a black [[muneate]] with her identifier "Shi" marked on it. 

Her [[rigging]] is an archery-based setup comprising her [[flight deck]] to her right arm, [[brown gloves|brown]] [[yugake]], multiple [[anti-aircraft gun]] placements on her waist and thigh boots, and a [[quiver]] to her back. 

She is generally depicted as a calm, gentle, and polite woman. This references her career in which she was often damaged in battle and frequently sent back home for repairs, which can be interpreted as her staying at home for "housekeeping".

Her [[abyssal ship|abyssal]] form is assumed to be the [[Aircraft Carrier Water Oni]].

title: dartrix
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0723 in the National Pokédex, a Grass/Flying-type starter.

Resembles an [[owl]] with [[closed eyes]] and white, brown, and green plumage.

Evolves from [[Rowlet]], and into [[Decidueye]].

Japanese name: [b]Fukuthrow[/b]

title: torracat
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0726 in the National Pokédex, a Fire-type starter.

Resembles a [[cat]]. Has [[black fur|black]] and [[red fur|reddish]]-[[orange fur]], as well as a fiery [[neck bell]].

Evolves from [[Litten]], and into [[Incineroar]].

Japanese name: [b]Nyaheat[/b]

title: sports_bra
body:
A tight-fitting top worn for breast support during sports or exercise. Despite its name, it is typically not considered [[underwear]]. It is intended for wear during vigorous exercise that might cause the [[breasts]] to move uncomfortably or excessively, preventing discomfort and potential embarrassment during exercise.

h4. Examples

* !post #3393331

h4. See also

* [[bandeau]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Sports bra":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sports_bra

title: stufful
body:
[[Pokemon_(creature)|Pokémon]] #0759 in the National Pokédex, a Normal/Fighting-type. 

Resembles a [[bear]] or [[panda]] [[cub]]. Its body and head are mostly pink, while its legs are brown. There is a single, pink paw pad on the bottom of each foot.

Evolves into [[Bewear]].

Japanese name: [b]Nuikoguma[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #2459570
* !post #9954577

Prior Pokémon: [[Salazzle]]
Next Pokémon: [[Bewear]]

title: nagai_gojitsudan_no_nechronica
body:
[i]Nagai Gojitsudan no Nechronica[/i], Nechronica -The Long Long Sequel- aka. "Nechronica" 

Japanese [[zombie]] girl-themed tabletop RPG created by [[kamiya_ryou_(zq_works)|Kamiya Ryou]] and Tsugihagi Honpo. Illustrated by [[kikai_(akita_morgue)|Kikai]] (main illustrator), [[Harukaze Unipo]] and [[Ogihara Mach]]. The game is currently published by Incog.Lab.

h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Role-playing Games]]

h4. External Links 

* "Incog.Lab":http://incoglab.com/
* "Official page":http://www.nechronica.com/ 
* "TLWiki":http://tlwiki.org/index.php?title=Nechronica
other_names: 永い後日談のネクロニカ

title: amiya_(arknights)
body:
[i]Amiya, leader of Rhodes Island, will fight alongside you.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

The public face and one of the top executives of Rhodes Island. Although she appears to be a young and inexperienced girl, she is universally trusted and highly qualified for her position. She is the first person the [[Doctor (Arknights)|]] sees when they wake up from their cryosleep at the beginning of the story.

She appear to be a young girl between the ages of 14-15 years old, with [[brown hair]] in a [[ponytail]]. She wears a [[blue ascot]], [[miniskirt]] and Rhodes Island [[Jacket]] in her official character design.

Her ears are meant to resemble those of a [[rabbit ears|rabbit]]. However, due to the way those ears are drawn, many fans joke that "she looks like a donkey":[/pools/18086]. 

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Kurosawa Tomoyo]].

h4. Profile

[expand]
"Doctor, I'm so glad that we're back together. And we'll walk this path together! I've got your back if you've got mine."
- Amiya

title: eggplant
body:
Egg-shaped [[fruit]] having a glossy skin and white flesh. Usually has a purple skin, but also comes in other colors such as white and orange. Used as a [[vegetable]] in cooking, closely related to [[tomato|tomatoes]] and [[potato|potatoes]]. Also refers to the [[plant]], which is a hairy [[herb]] of the nightshade family. Also known as an "aubergine" in the UK and Ireland.


h4. See also

* [[Tag Group:Food Tags]]
* [[shouryouuma]]
* [[hatsuyume]]

title: aerith_gainsborough
body:
Playable character from [[Final Fantasy VII]], featured in the Compilation ([[final fantasy vii advent children|Advent Children]], [[before crisis final fantasy vii|Before Crisis]], [[crisis core final fantasy vii|Crisis Core]]) and the [[final fantasy vii remake|Remake]]. Also a supporting character in the [[Kingdom Hearts]] series. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] worn in a [[rope braid|rope]] [[braided ponytail]] (often mistaken or simplified as a regular braid) with [[parted bangs]] and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[sidelocks]], fastened with a [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]] and sometimes a visible green [[materia]], [[green eyes]], [[medium breasts]], sometimes [[pale skin]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket]] with [[short sleeves]] ([[puffy short sleeves]] in the original [[Final Fantasy VII|FFVII]]) over a [[long dress|long]] [[pink dress|pink]] [[sleeveless dress]] with [[brown footwear|brown]] [[boots]], a [[flower choker]] (simple [[ribbon choker]] prior to [[Final Fantasy VII Remake|FF7R]]) and [[bangle]]s on each wrist. Often carries a [[yellow flower]] and [[flower basket]] and wields a [[staff]].

She was first voiced in English by Mandy Moore in Kingdom Hearts, she was later voiced by Mena Suvari in Kingdom Hearts II and Advent Children, then by Andrea Bowen in Crisis Core and Kingdom Hearts III.  Her voice in the remake and Crisis Core Reunion is performed by Briana White.  Her voice in all Japanese media is performed by [[Sakamoto Maaya]].

First known abroad as [i]Aeris[/i].

title: ganbaru_pose
body:
Derived from the word 頑張る (ganbaru), meaning "to do one's best" or "persevere," the ganbaru pose is often used when cheering someone on. Typically involves raising [[hands up|both hands]] in a [[clenched hands|clenched]] position.

h4. See also

* [[ganbaruzoi]] (meme)
* [[ei ei mun!]] (meme)

title: ganbaruzoi
body:
Parody of the [[meme|memetic]] line 「今日も一日がんばるぞい！」by [[Suzukaze Aoba]] from [[NEW GAME!]]. This has been translated as "I'll do my best today as well!", among other variations.

h4. See also

* [[ganbaru pose]] 

h4. External links

* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: 今日も一日がんばるぞい!":[http://dic.pixiv.net/a/%E4%BB%8A%E6%97%A5%E3%82%82%E4%B8%80%E6%97%A5%E3%81%8C%E3%82%93%E3%81%B0%E3%82%8B%E3%81%9E%E3%81%84!]

title: gigi_murin
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s 4th generation [[holoJustice]]. Designed by [[Makihitsuji]].

Lore-wise, she is a [[gremlin (mythology)|]], with [[pink eyes]] and [[short hair|short]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[brown hair]] done in [[short twintails]].  A bit unusually, she has both [[sharp teeth]] [i]and[/i] [[fangs]] (all her teeth are pointed, but the canines are notably more prominent than the others). And a long [[tail|black Tail]].

h4. Costumes

h5. Regular costumes

* !post #7734854: [[Gigi Murin (1st costume)|Default]]
* !post #8650626: [[gigi murin (new year)|New Year]]

h5. Other costumes

* !post #8292657: [[Swimsuit]] (hololive's Secret Island Vacation)
* !asset #23880704: [[Smol Gigi]] (by [[pyroxene]], for holoJustice's Trick or Treat collab)
* !post #9675538: [[Gigi Murin (Holonatsu Paradise)|holoNatsu Paradise]]

h4. See also

* [[Popo (gigi murin)|]] - Channel mascot
* [[Grem (gigi murin)|]] - Fanbase
* [[Gigi Murin (artist)]] - Artist tag
* [[Boat goes binted]]
* [[Gigi Murin's September karaoke stream]]

h4. External links

* "YouTube channel":https://www.youtube.com/@holoen_gigimurin
* "Twitter":https://twitter.com/gigimurin

title: volvo
body:
Name shared by two formerly-related Swedish companies. Most commonly associated with "Volvo Cars":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvo_Cars], a luxury vehicle manufacturer, sold by parent conglomerate "Volvo Group":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volvo] to [[Ford]] in 1999, and then by Ford to "Geely":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geely] in 2010. 

Previously Volvo's subsidiary, [[Polestar_(Company)|]] became a standalone brand in 2017, partially owned by Volvo and Geely.

Volvo Group keeps the businesses of producing buses, trucks, and construction equipment, and has acquired [[Renault]]'s "truck division":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Renault_Trucks] along with its subsidiary [[mack (brand)|Mack Trucks]].

title: crabominable
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0740 in the National Pokédex, a Fighting/Ice-type.

Resembles a mix between a [[crab]] and a [[yeti (creature)|]]. Its body is covered in [[white fur]], and has light [[yellow hair]] with [[antenna hair|two longer hairs sticking out]] on top.

Evolves from [[Crabrawler]].

Japanese name: [b]Kekenkani[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9562375

* "Bulbapedia":https://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Crabominable_(Pok%C3%A9mon)

Next Pokémon: [[Oricorio]]

title: charjabug
body:

title: blue_oath
body:
Blue Oath (alternatively Blue Wars or Blue Vows) was a shipgirl-themed Chinese smartphone game released in China by Babeltime. A Japanese version was published by ZephyrusGames, and was available on the Android and iOS Japanese app stores. The game ran on Android, Apple iOS and Windows-based devices. By August 2023, all of the game's servers were shut down.

Gameplay was similar to [[Kantai Collection]] Arcade, although with both minor and major changes, such as an affection system (and allowing marriage at 100 affection instead of Level 99), Hot Springs for morale recovery, the ability to select damaged skins for the ship girls’ appearance and in-app purchases.

title: eyjafjalla_(arknights)
body:
[i]Eyjafjalla, Caster Operator of Rhodes Island, has wanted to devote herself to doing something for you.[/i]

A playable Caster Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real Name: Adele Naumann

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Leithanien[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]October 18[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Caprinae[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]145 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]None[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

A world renowned volcanologist and catastrophe messenger from Leithanien. She is exceptionally talented in the use of advanced Originium techniques and high-energy Arts. Her Oripathy is quite severe, which has made her nearly deaf. She is currently undergoing treatment at Rhodes Island, while providing support in Catastrophe research, environmental observation/assessment, assistance in traversing dangerous terrain, among others. She is the daughter of [[Katia Naumann]] (father) and [[Magna Naumann]] (mother).

Her motif is based on sheep. Her callsign is a reference to the Icelandic volcano [i]Eyjafjallajökull[/i].

Her [[voice actor]] is [[Taneda Risa]].

h4. Appearance

title: sofia_(toushinden)
body:
A dominatrix-clad fighter in [[Toushinden]] who joins the tournament to regain her memories. [spoiler]She learns the Himitsu Kessha tampered with her memories so she wouldn't remember being the prototype for a killer whom the syndicate could control remotely via brainwashing.[/spoiler]

Sofia remains positive after this revelation and rebonds with her family to make new memories, but the second tournament is organized and she feels she must participate. [spoiler]Sofia meets the final version of the brainwashing experiment in another fighter named Chaos, whom she tries to save but ultimately cannot.[/spoiler]

Sofia's design and storyline are incredibly similar to [[Virtua Fighter]]'s [[Sarah Bryant]].

title: darklord_ixchel
body:
Japanese name: 堕天使イシュタム (Datenshi Ixtab)
English name: Darklord Ixchel

The second female member of "Darklords":http://yugioh.wikia.com/wiki/Darklord. She has [[red eyes]], [[dark skin]] and [[purple hair]] styled with [[swept bangs]] and [[head wings]]. Being a member of Darklord clan that comprises with [[fallen angel]], naturally she has [[black wings]] and [[halo]]. Also, her body is adorned with various kinds of jewelry like [[bracelet]] and [[armlet]]. Both of her names originate from Mayan mythology.

body:
A [i][[Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle]][/i]. He is an event organizer that has an interest in rap battle events. He typically has a gentlemanly personality and is a frequenter of the Port Harbor bar where the [[Protagonist (hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle)|]] works.

[spoilers]His true profession is that of a drug trafficker that produces "Charms"—coin-shaped containers that contain drugs.[/spoilers]

title: sono_(real)_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]] Re:Dive. Isurugi Sono, the player of [[Sono (Princess Connect!)|]] in the real world.

Unlike her in-game avatar, she looks much older, with [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[ribbed sweater|ribbed]] [[turtleneck sweater]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] and a [[high-waist skirt]].

title: kikeroga_(gquuuuuux)
body: A fictional manned [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] mechaverse. It appears in [[Gundam Gquuuuuux]]. MAN-03 Kikeroga A [spoiler]variable geometry[/spoiler] Newtype use [[Mobile Armor]] that is this continuity's [[Braw Bro]]. It shares the same identification number and resembles a smaller version of it. The Kikeroga is operated by [[Zeon]]ic Newtype ace [[Challia Bull]]. It has [[funnels (gundam)|]] and powerful [[beam cannon]]s. Its name is derived from an [[kikeroga|unused mecha]] from the original outline notes of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]], which also called it a "Braw Bro-like mecha." [spoiler]Unlike the original Braw Bro, the Kikeroga can transform into a humanoid MS form, which some otaku have noticed has a resemblance to [[Ultraseven (series)|]]'s [[Poll Seijin]].[/spoiler]

title: nakiri_amiria
body: A [i][[Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle]][/i] character. She is the owner of Port Harbor, a bar in Yokohama where the [[Protagonist (Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle)|protagonist]] works, and a good friend of [[Doudantsutsuji Rokuro]]. She cares deeply for Rokuro and the protagonist, always showing concern for the two of them. Though, Rokuro does describe her as a smooth talker with a love for customers who spend big.

title: doudantsutsuji_rokuro
body: A [i][[Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle]][/i] character. He is a famous DJ, known as DJ ROKURO, and a former military medical officer. He took the game's [[protagonist_(hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle)|protagonist]] under his wing before the story, but does not acknowledge them as his apprentice.

title: protagonist_(hypnosis_mic:_alternative_rap_battle)
body: The main character of [i][[Hypnosis Mic: Alternative Rap Battle]][/i]. An apprentice DJ training under [[Doudantsutsuji Rokuro]]. A war orphan who was rescued by [[Busujima Mason Rio]] before being approached by Rokuro. They work as a dishwasher at a bar in the backstreets of Yokohama called Port Harbor owned by [[Nakiri Amiria]]. Their design, personality, gender, and age are up to player's interpretation, though they are shown to be a somewhat helpful and kind person.

title: barbaracle
body:
[[Pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0689 in the National Pokédex, a Rock/Water-type. 

Consists of seven [[barnacle]]-like creatures connected by two [[rocks]], and arranged in a humanoid formation - two legs, [[extra amrs|four arms]], and one head. They each have long [[claws]], and all but the legs have puffy, orange cheeks. The main head has two eyes, while the arms have [[one-eyed|just one]], and the legs have an orange, four-pointed [[star]].

Evolves from [[Binacle]].

Japanese name: [b]Gamenodes[/b]

h4. Official art
* !post #9561343

h4. External links

Next Pokémon: [[Skrelp]]

title: gambier_bay_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the [i]Casablanca[/i]-class escort carrier USS [i]Gambier Bay[/i] (CVE-73). Character design by [[Akira (Kadokawa)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She has [[blue eyes]], [[blonde hair]] and [[large breasts]]. Her hair is worn in large fluffy [[twintails]] that reach down to her shoulders. She wears a [[hairband]] in Measure 32 camo with radar antennae to one side. Her clothing consists of a [[blue_shirt|blue]] [[collared shirt]] with [[breast pocket]]s, alongside a [[belt]] and [[shorts]] in Measure 32 camouflage. She also wears [[gloves]] with a white top and black underside, as well as [[white thighhighs]]. The one on her left leg bears her hull number, which is also found on her [[flight deck]].

She has a rather timid personality, generally sounding very meek and self-doubting due to her history, not helped by the common nickname for CVEs being "Combustible, Vulnerable, Expendable" due to their poor overall protection. Because of this, she often has a [[wavy mouth]] and looks as if she's on the verge of [[crying]]. She is also extremely fearful of her Japanese counterparts, especially capital ships, constantly worrying that they may fire upon her at any moment. She's often depicted as a [[lost child]] due to her [[Gambier Bay (Sasebo) (Kancolle)|Sasebo]] outfit; see "Lost Gambier Bay":[/pools/13799].

The historical [i]Gambier Bay[/i] was sunk in the Battle of Samar during the Battle of Leyte Gulf after taking gunfire from [i][[Chikuma (Kancolle)|]][/i], with [i][[Yamato (Kancolle)|]][/i] finishing her off. She was the only American aircraft carrier sunk by enemy surface gunfire during World War II, and also the [i]Yamato[/i]'s only confirmed kill.

Her abyssal form is assumed to be the [[Escort Water Princess]].

title: army_of_the_republic_of_vietnam
body:
Posts containing references to the real life Army of the Republic of Vietnam, such as depictions of historical events, [[military vehicle]]s, or [[soldier]]s with clear evidence of the colors or uniforms of South [[Vietnam]].

h4. History

The Army of the Republic of Vietnam (ARVN) was the [[military]] arm of the anti-communist nation of South Vietnam, from the country's inception during the post-colonial division of Indochina in 1955, until the reunification of Vietnam in 1975. During those twenty years, ARVN was effectively in a constant state of war against [[communism|communist]] forces: fighting both a [[guerilla]] insurgency in the south of the country against the [[viet cong|National Liberation Front]], and a conventional conflict in the north of the country against the North Vietnam's military arm, the [[People's Army of Vietnam]] (PAVN).

Even after the mass deployment of American and Allied forces in 1965, ARVN forces continued to bear the brunt of the fighting during the [[Vietnam War]]. Unfortunately, ARVN also became more and more tied to the politics of South Vietnam, and political officer appointments, corruption and factional infighting continually degraded the army's ability to continue the conflict. Despite these issues, ARVN's efforts continued to prove decisive, from 1967 to 1968 to 1972.

The withdrawal of Allied troops in 1973, end of American supplies in 1974, and PAVN offensive in 1975 together proved to be the death knell for South Vietnam. Though ARVN troops continued to fight bravely in places, even lacking arms and ammunition, the country they fought to defend was rapidly collapsing. On 30 April 1975, PAVN forces captured the South Vietnamese capital city of Saigon (modern day [[Ho Chi Minh]] City), and what was left of the South Vietnamese government either surrendered or fled. The Army of the Republic of Vietnam, and the country said army was pledged to defend, had ceased to exist. 

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Army of the Republic of Vietnam":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Army_of_the_Republic_of_Vietnam

It consists of a [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress|white]] [[china dress]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], a [[brown pantyhose|brown]] [[single leg pantyhose]] with [[hip vent]]s, a [[grey cape]] with [[lapels]], [[black gloves|black]] [[half gloves]], a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] and a pair of [[black shoes|black]] [[high heels]]. She also has a [[butterfly hat ornament]] on her beret, a [[pink flower]] attached to her left lapel and multiple [[tassel]]s throughout her outfit. title: pokemon
body:
[ [[list_of_pokemon_media|media]] | [[list_of_pokemon_characters|people]] | [[list_of_pokemon|creatures]] | [[list_of_pokemon_objects|objects]] | [[list_of_pokemon_places|places]] | [[list_of_pokemon_moves|moves]] | [[list_of_pokemon_abilities|abilities]] | [[pool group:pokemon|pools]] | [[help:pokemon tags|help]] ]

Pokémon (ポケットモンスター, [i]Pocket Monsters[/i]) is a highly popular [[tag group:role-playing games|RPG series]] developed by Tajiri Satoshi, with art by [[Sugimori Ken]], for [[Nintendo]] handheld video game devices since 1996, and has since spawned several spinoff games, [[pokemon adventures|manga]], and [[pokemon (anime)|an anime series]].

In the main games, the player character goes on a journey through various cities, towns and landscape (caves, forests, sea, etc.) and meets creatures known as [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. The player is able to collect Pokémon to form a personalized team, train them to make them stronger, choose their known skills and command them to fight against other Pokémon. People who do that are Pokémon Trainers. Many NPCs are Pokémon Trainers available to fight against the player.

The storyline advances as the player gains eight [[badge (pokemon)|badges]] for defeating different Gym Leaders and eventually challenges the Elite Four and the current Champion; defeating them all grants the player the title of Champion for himself/herself. Typical side quests, such as finding a specific item or person, are also required at certain points. Additionally, the player repeatedly fights against his or her personal rivals and routinely clashes with a criminal organization.

h4. Tagging

See [[help:pokemon tags|Help:Pokémon tags]].

h4. See also

* [[list_of_pokemon|List of Pokémon]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_characters|List of Pokémon Characters]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_objects|List of Pokémon Objects]]
* [[list_of_pokemon_media|List of Pokémon Media]]
* [[pool group:pokemon|Pool group:Pokémon]]
* [[pokemon battle|Pokémon Battle]]
* [[poke ball theme|Poké Ball theme]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pok%C3%A9mon
* "Official Site (Japan)":http://www.pokemon.co.jp
* "Official Site (USA)":http://www.pokemon.com

title: crossdraw_holster
body:
A [[holster]] requiring the wearer to draw the weapon with the hand on the opposite side. These are often worn under a [[jacket]] for concealed carrying.

Some of these are worn on the hip. However, by the above definition, a [[shoulder holster]] is also a crossdraw holster.

h4. See also

title: antennae
body:
A feeler organ on the head of a [[bug]], [[crab]], or other [[animal]].  This tag also includes artificial antennae that mimic the shape of biological antennae. 

To describe locks of hair that stick up from a characters head, please use [[antenna hair]] tag.

For the electronic devices that send and/or receive radio signals use the [[radio antenna]] tag instead.

h4. See also

* [[fake antennae]]

title: crowbar
body:
A hooked or curved steel bar that used as a [[tools|tool]] to open locked, closed or other inaccessible object, usually [[crate]]s or [[door]]s made of wood or metal, or demolish items and structure, like sledgehammer. it has two flat claws on both ends to pry the object open, its "teeth" the gap on the claw of its hooked end (hooked end is also known as the crowbar "heel") is used as an physical space for prying [[nail (hardware)|]] out of wooden [[plank]]. 

Signature weapon of [[Gordon Freeman]] of the [[Half-life (series)|]] series and [[Nyarlathotep (Nyaruko-san)|Nyarlathotep]] of [[Haiyore! Nyaruko-san]].

title: ryoune_yami
body:
Ryoune Yami is a [[trap]] [[UTAU]] voicebank & character, voiced by [[Kiki (tsunya)]].

His design is taken from the /cm/ board of [[4chan]]'s genderswapped/trap version of the "Ecstasy AKA Darks" [[meme]]. Said meme originated from 4chan's /a/ board back in 2007. The original image of Darks was an image of someone's self-insert original character posted on DeviantArt, said image depicted a poorly-drawn generic emo boy with blue-dyed black hair and a small list of his likes (Blood, Death, Knives, Psycos, Pointy objects, Green Day, and staying up all night), dislikes (Peace and love), age (13), and height (5"2). 

A copy of the original image can be found "here":[http://i.imgur.com/fZxYVxY.jpg].

Sometime in 2010, someone took /cm/'s super kawaii version of Darks and turned him into a Vocaloid trap. He retained most of his characteristics but was given a different name so that trolls wouldn't find him. He dresses up as a girl, does covers of songs using his own UTAU sound bank, and has buttsex with other fan-made UTAUs for the amusement of young yaoi fangirls on DeviantArt.

This page and tag on danbooru is for the created UTAU.

title: kirito_(sao-ggo)
body:
The Gun Gale Online avatar of [[Kirito]], from the [[Sword Art Online]] series, that appears in volumes 5 and 6 of the light novels.

Kirito allowed the game to give him a randomly generated appearance, and ended up with an extremely rare "M9000" male avatar that shares most of the same appearances as the rare "F1300" female avatar.

He is a [[trap]] with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], [[black eyes]], a black jacket, and a white breastplate. He wields an [[energy sword]] and an [[FN Five-Seven]] [[handgun]].

title: shotadom
body:
A sexual situation in which the dominant partner in an [[onee-shota]] or [[onii-shota]] [[age difference]] relationship is the younger boy.

Posts reflecting a shotadom situation would show the boy penetrating, rather than being penetrated, when having sex. Non-H images will usually show him looking more confident or physically overpowering the older party, and may sometimes be linked with BDSM by having the older party be bound or kept on a [[leash]]. Many will also depict the boy as a [[power bottom]].

The gender inversion of this is [[lolidom]].

h4. Similar archetypes
* [[josou seme]] - when a [[trap]] is the dominant partner
* [[assertive female]] - when a girl is the dominant partner in a heterosexual relationship
** [[femdom]]
* [[power bottom]] - when the penetrated is the dominant partner
* [[muscular uke]] - when the receiving or submissive partner is more muscular than their top

title: halo
body:
A bright ring or circle of light typically hovering above or traditionally behind the head that either symbolizes purity or to denote that the character is an [[angel]] or [[icon (religion)|saint]]. This tag applies to all kinds of halos which hover over one's head, not just those that are considered traditional - for such halos only, see [[traditional halo]].

Not to be confused with the optical phenomenon caused by ice crystals in the atmosphere surrounding the sun or moon, forming a halo, or halo-like artifacts of light caused by bright light sources interacting with the camera lens. The latter is a [[lens flare]].

For the video game, see [[Halo (series)|]].

h4. Examples

* !post #3863748: [[Traditional halo]]
* !post #7699094: Non-traditional halos

title: ash_crimson
body:

He was designed to be an "ambiguous, lovably evil main character", hence the [[androgynous]] or [[trap]] tags.

He is voiced by Nagashiro Sounosuke [長代 聡之介].

title: camilla_(rance)
body:
Character from the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]], introduced in the non-canon [[Kichikuou Rance]] and the main antagonist of [[Rance VI]].

One of the oldest surviving Dark Lords, Camilla is a former dragon who was the only female of her race, serving as nothing but a trophy wife for reproduction. She is affiliated with the Supreme Dark Lord [[Kayblis]] and his faction, but adamently hates him.

She is notorious for her attraction to young and/or feminine boys, particularly [[trap]]s. In Kichikuou Rance, she enjoys full-blown [[shota]].

title: traditional_halo
body:
The round circular ring often associated with depictions of [[angel]]s.

Traditional [[halo]]s should be simple solid rings, with no protrusions or extra details. Damaged or broken halos still count if they adhere to these standards.  Do not use for [[fake_halo|fake]] or [[mechanical_halo|mechanical]] halos.

For when the halo is also glowing, see [[glowing halo]], which may or may not also be a traditional halo.

h4. Examples

* !post #7067585

title: battlefield_6
body:
The upcoming eighteenth installment in the [[Battlefield_(series)|]] series. The game is set in 2027 and features a world-spanning conflict between a fractured NATO and Pax Armata, a private military company backed by former NATO states.

title: battlefield_2042
body:
The seventeenth installment in the [[Battlefield_(series)|]] series. The game is set in the 2040s, where the world experiences near total societal collapse due to the deteriorating climate. As a result, the [[United States]] and the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] become the only superpowers, and fight over the remaining resources by employing No-Pats; refugees and exiles without a national identity, due to them being affected by the game's events.

h4. See also

title: battlefield_4
body:
The 2013 sequel to [[Battlefield 3]] as part of the [[Battlefield (series)|]] series. Serving as the seventh installment in the series, the game takes place during the War of 2020, where the [[United States]] and the [[Russia|Russian Federation]] continue to fight after six years as a result of the events of the previous game. Meanwhile, the [[China|People's Republic of China]] experiences an internal conflict as rogue members of the military orchestrate a coup d'etat to join the war with Russia against the United States.

h4. See also 

* [[Battlefield (series)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Battlefield 4":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlefield_4]
* "Wikipedia: Battlefield (video game series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlefield_(video_game_series)]

title: battlefield_3
body:
The third game in the [[Battlefield (series)|]] series, released in 2011.

The single-player campaign follows the story of [[united states marine corps|U.S. Marine]] Sergeant Henry "Black" Blackburn and is set in various locations around the world, including [[Iran]], [[New York City]], and [[Paris]]. The narrative focuses on a conflict between the [[United States]] and an organization known as the People's Liberation and Resistance, a fictional Iranian paramilitary insurgent group based largely in the Middle East.

h4. See also 

* [[Battlefield (series)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Battlefield 3":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlefield_3]

title: battlefield:_bad_company
body:
The sixth installment in the [[Battlefield_(series)|]] series. The game depicts the exploits of Preston Marlowe and his squad's attempt to become rich by stealing gold from a mercenary group, whilst serving in "B" company; also known as Bad Company due to the company being comprised of troublemakers in the [[United States]] military.

It received a sequel in 2010 titled [[Battlefield: Bad Company 2|Bad Company 2]].

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia: Battlefield (video game series)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battlefield_(video_game_series)]

title: battlefield_2142
body:
The fourth overall installment of the [[Battlefield (series)|]] series. The game is in the 22nd century, where the European Union and the Pan-Asian Coalition; a military alliance comprising of Eurasian countries, fight over the remaining habitable land on Earth during a new ice age.

title: battlefield_2
body:
The third installment in the [[Battlefield_(series)|]] series. The game is set in a global conflict between the [[United States]] with the European Union, and the [[china|People's Republic of China]] with the Middle Eastern Coalition; a military alliance comprised of various Arab states. A later expansion focuses on operations between special forces units and paramilitary organizations.

title: musashi_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese battleship [i]Musashi[/i]. Character design by [[Shizuma Yoshinori]], voiced by [[Misato (voice actor)|]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] in [[two side up]] style and [[twintails]], [[brown eyes|brown]]/[[red eyes]], [[dark skin]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of chest [[bandages]] in a [[sarashi]] style, [[black cape|black]] [[capelet]] with a [[red sailor collar]], [[kikumon]] collar, [[red skirt|red]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[rudder footwear]]. The only visible difference in her [[Musashi Kai (Kancolle)|kai form]] is that her red skirt and jacket/capelet turn black.

Her [[rigging]] consists of two hull pieces in a half-circle and held by a funnel to her back, containing her three 46 cm triple gun mounts and four 15.5 cm triple gun mounts (base) or two 15.5 plus six 12.7 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mounts (kai); [[thigh strap]]s with armor-piercing shells, and a headpiece based off her real-life rangefinder. At Kai, her rigging adds several [[Type 96 AA gun]]s. 

She has a boastful, battle-hungry personality, contrasting with the more reserved [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]]. Her looks and personality stem from how the actual battleship's sinking involved taking an incredible amount of punishment, although like Yamato, she never actually engaged in surface combat.

title: halford_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer USS [i]Halford[/i] (DD-480), as part of the [[World of Warships]] collaboration. While having existed in real life, she is depicted in her original 1943 experimental configuration as an aircraft-carrying destroyer.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] done in [[twintails]], and [[red eyes]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[layered dress|two-layer]] [[black dress|black]] and [[white dress]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], black [[frilled hairband]] containing her [[headphones]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[high heels]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life aircraft catapult to her right and her real-life forward 533 mm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]] to her left. Her planes are [[F8F Bearcat]]s armed with Tiny Tim rockets that has floats applied for scouting and attacking purposes, launched from a teddy bear familiar to her back.

In real life, she received an [[aircraft catapult]] for a float plane in place of her aft torpedo mount and one of her main guns, allowing the ship to launch a Kingfisher scout observation plane. The catapult turned out not to be operationally suitable for the intended purpose and was ultimately removed from Halford in October 1943. However, in World of Warships, she get her catapult back while having her AA Defenses upgraded and she participated during Leyte Gulf. The Aircraft she carried are Floatplane versions of the [[F8F Bearcat]]s.

title: bell_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the destroyer USS [i]Bell[/i] (DD-587). 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a [[butterfly hair ornament]], [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. Her default outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[white jacket|white]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black necktie]], [[sleeveless]] [[double-breasted]] [[white shirt]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black pantyhose]], and [[black footwear|black shoes]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of all five of her historic 127 mm single gun mounts and two 533 mm quintuple [[torpedo tubes]].

title: bache_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the American destroyer [i]Bache[/i]. Character design by [[waterkuma]], voiced by Kaneko Sayaka.

Her design as well as her personality were based on a [[pun]] of her name that reads almost the same as the word "bitch". As such, she is depicted as a "[[mesugaki]]" [[gyaru]]. She has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[two side up]] and a [[purple eyes]], she wears a [[black_headwear|black]] [[sailor hat]] with golden anchor decoration, a golden [[fur trim]]med [[jacket]], a [[black_shirt|black]] [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]] [[serafuku]] with a yellow ribbon, a [[pink collar]] with a golden ring, and a [[short shorts|very short]] [[denim shorts]].

title: ringer_box
body:
A box with mounted electric bells (usually two). Used with early [[phone|telephones]] to notify of incoming calls before the onset of internal phone ringers.

These are most common as part of [[antique phone|antique]] [[phone on wall|wall mounted]] telephone units. They often feature a [[rotary phone|rotary dial]] and a [[crank]], with a [[corded phone|corded]] handset or a corded receiver ([[candlestick phone]] style) with the transmitter on the box.

h4. Examples

* !post #3316812
* !post #3825591

h4. See also

* [[antique phone]]

* [[rotary phone]]

title: mare_bello_fiore
body:
Character from the series [[overlord_(maruyama)|Overlord by Maruyama]]. One of the floor guardians protecting the Great Tomb of Nazarick. Mare is an [[elf]] [[trap]] and timid in personality. He is skilled at magic but can also do close combat when pushed. Nicknamed "Unreliable Envoy Of Nature" due to the aforementioned reasons. [[Aura Bella Fiora]] is his older sister.

title: miyanokouji_mizuho
body:
Protagonist of [[Otome Wa Boku Ni Koishiteru]], [[voice actor|voiced by]] [[Horie Yui]].

Goes by Kaburagi Mizuho in real life, before a clause in his grandfather's will bids him attend an all-girls school.

He looks [[androgynous]] enough that when masquerading, he becomes a [[trap]].

title: kujira-chan_(hina_misora)
body:
Character from [[Hina Misora]]'s streams. He is a [[whale]] who rescued Hina after she fell from the sky into the ocean, and adopted her into their family. Also called Ballena-chan or Kujira-kun.

Kujira-chan is often depicted in [[personification|human form]] as a "[[trap]]" with [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]], [[blue eyes]] and a [[cetacean tail|whale tail]], wearing a [[pink sweater]] with a [[white collar|white]] [[sailor collar]], and a [[blue headwear|blue]] [[whale hat]].

title: greninja
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0658 in the National Pokédex, a Water/Dark-type starter.

Resembles a bipedal, blue [[frog]]. Has a [[very long tongue]] that it uses as a [[scarf]]. It throws [[shuriken]]s made of [[water]].

Evolves from [[Frogadier]] (from [[Froakie]]). It can also [[mega pokemon|Mega Evolve]].

Greninja with the [i]Battle Bond[/i] [[pokemon ability|ability]] can transform into [[Ash-Greninja]].

Playable in the [[Super Smash Bros.]] series.

Japanese name: [b]Gekkouga[/b]

A drawing trend where an artist draws three versions of a character.
A normal version, a simplified [[deformed]] version, and a [[chibi]] version.
The [[character name|name of the character]] also changes from their full name, to their nickname, and ultimately to a heavily simplified name.

The original is a drawing by artist [[lontongs]] featuring [[Gorou (Genshin Impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]].

title: serafuku
body:
The [[school uniform]] with a [[sailor collar|sailor-style collar]] worn by Japanese schoolgirls in middle school and high school. The standard uniform consists of a white [[blouse]], a [[pleated skirt]], and a red [[neckerchief]], but there are as many variations as there are stars in the sky. 
 
Serafukus are commonly worn with a [[ribbon]] or [[bow]] in lieu of the traditional neckerchief. The line between "neckerchief" and "bow" is blurry, as the bows worn with serafukus often aren't actually dedicated bows or [[bowtie|bowties]], but rather a neckerchief tied into a bow instead of its intended scarf-like shape.
 
A serafuku always includes a [[skirt]]. If a sailor-style top is paired with shorts or another bottom, [[sailor shirt]] should be used instead. In fact, sailor suits with shorts are the older, original style: in the Victorian and Edwardian eras, they were used as boys' suits, from which then the girls' uniform with a skirt was derived.

For colored serafuku tags, both the [[shirt]] and [[skirt]] must match in color to apply, but not the neckwear or [[sailor collar]].

[[Sailor dress]]es should not be tagged as serafuku.
 
h4. Examples

* !post #7976696: [[Summer uniform]]
* !post #7610906: [[Winter uniform]]
* !post #8805259: [[white serafuku]][br]Shirt and skirt must be white.

title: delphox
body:
[[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] #0655 in the National Pokédex, a Fire/Psychic-type starter.

Resembles a bipedal [[fox]] with a coat of [[red fur|red]], [[robe]]-like fur. Has [[fangs]]. [[claws]], and three [[animal ear fluff|tufts of fur]] protruding out of each ear. Carries a [[stick]] that it uses like a magic [[wand]]; when in use, the tip is [[fire|set alight]], and when not in use, it is hidden in its "sleeve."

Evolves from [[Braixen]] (from [[Fennekin]]). It can also [[Mega pokemon|Mega Evolve]].

Japanese name: [b]Mahoxy[/b]

title: akita_nero
body:
亞北ネロ (Akita Nero) is a [[Vocaloid]] derivative designed by [[Smith Hioka]] as [[Akita Neru]]'s younger brother.
He is a 13-year-old boy with [[blonde hair]] and an [[ahoge]].

When [[Hatsune Miku]]'s pictures became unsearchable on main search engines such as Google and Yahoo! Japan in 2007, an apocryphal rumor spread among [[2channel]]  users:
"The system engineers at Yahoo! Japan had not enough time to work out the bugs in their image recognition algorithms. They decided to check all unsearchable images [b]one by one manually[/b], to change all Miku's pictures to ’searchable’."
Nero was created as one of these poor, overworked part-time engineers in Yahoo!.

h4.See also

* Nero's first image, posted to 2ch on November 22, 2007: http://akita-neru.at.webry.info/200712/article_5.html
* "Nicopedia":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/434654
* [[List of Vocaloid derivatives]]

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_2
body:
[b]Sonic the Hedgehog 2[/b] (not to be confused with [[Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (8-bit)|]] or [[Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (movie)|]]) is the direct sequel to [[Sonic the Hedgehog 1]], Developed by Sonic Team and published by [[SEGA]] for the Sega Genesis [[game console]], It was released to [[Japan]] on November 21, 1992, and to the [[United States]] three days later on, November 24, 1992. 

The game follows [[Sonic the Hedgehog]] and his newly debuted sidekick Miles Prower, conveniently nicknamed [[tails (Sonic)|Tails]], adventure to gather the [[chaos emerald|Chaos Emerald's]] before [[Dr. Eggman]] can use them to power his Death Egg.

It plays like the first game, you run to the end goal as fast as you can, defeat Badnik's and collect rings to stay afloat. there are a few new mechanics though, such as the debut of the spindash, the spindash has [[Sonic The Hedgehog|Sonic]] or [[Tails (Sonic)|Tails]] curl up into a ball and rev up to go at super speeds in seconds! As well as introducing [[Super Sonic]], an ability [[Sonic The Hedgehog|Sonic]] can transform into when having all 7 [[chaos emerald|Chaos Emerald's]] and 50 rings.

h4. Trivia
* Despite being the sequel to [[Sonic the Hedgehog 1|Sonic the Hedgehog]], many believe [[Sonic CD]] to be the [i]real[/i] sequel. Sonic Origins seems to back this theory up as well.
* When initially released in [[Japan]] there were many bugs, which caused the game to be delayed for the American release.
* [[Super Sonic]] may be a homage to the [[Super Saiyan]] transformation from the [[Dragon Ball]] franchise.

h4. External Links
* "Sonic News Network: Sonic the Hedgehog 2":https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog
other_names: ソニック・ザ・ヘッジホッグ2

title: ceras_yanagida_lilienfeld
body:
A [[virtual youtuber|virtual school idol]] and member of [[Link! Like! Love Live!]]'s [[Edel Note]] from the 105th graduating class, first introduced as a third year at [[mizukawa school uniform|Mizukawa Girls' Middle School]].

She loves school idols, and is always thinking about them, even during class. She craves attention and is a bit clingy. Originally from [[Nagano prefecture|Nagano]], she was friends with [[Hinoshita Kaho]] from their time in the hospital together, and call each other “hospi-pals.” She enjoys playing the [[violin]], but according to her, it’s nothing more than a hobby.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[grey hair]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[blue eyes]]. Her hair is decorated with [[pink ribbon|pink]] [[hair ribbon]]s behind each ear. Viewers have observed that she has a [[large breasts|pretty sizable bust]].

Kaho calls her "Secchan," while she calls Kaho "Hana-chan."

Voiced by [[Miyake Miu]].

title: third-party_watermark
body:
When an image is [[watermark]]ed by a third-party website such as an image gallery, wallpaper site, or an anime or gaming website displaying [[official art]].

Third-party watermarks are disallowed on Danbooru. They are regarded as flaws that should be addressed by someone finding a watermark-free image and uploading it. Once one is uploaded, the image with the third-party watermark should be made a child post and flagged.

Sites such as Weibo which add the artist's username as a watermark should not be tagged third-party watermark except in cases of [[third-party source]]s.

title: freaky_satono_diamond_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originating from an [[AI-generated]] video made with Doubao AI shared on [[tencent qq|QQ]] in early July 2025 (and later [[Bilibili]] in late August) featuring [[Satono Diamond (umamusume)|]] with a [[very long tongue]] sticking [[tongue out|out of her mouth]]. 

In an amusing twist of fate, "a photo":[https://x.com/sametokaiuno/status/1961747582235091130] of the real [[Satono Diamond (racehorse)|]] with his tongue sticking out at his stable would be uploaded in the final days of August, resparking interest in the meme. 

h4. Origin

* !asset #31745339: "Original (official Bilibili upload)":https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV19PYXzKEeL

h4. See also

* [[AI-generated art (topic)]]

title: the_super_mario_bros._movie
body:
Animated film by Illumination based on the [[Mario (series)|]] series, notably featuring an all-star cast of celebrities to voice the characters. Released on April 5, 2023 in the United States and more than 59 more markets with a later Japanese showing on April 28, 2023.

Has grossed over US$1.36 billion in the box office worldwide against a US$100 million budget and been setting records in the process (including the highest-grossing film based on a video game and the first film based on a video game to gross at least US$1 billion, the second highest-grossing film of 2023, and the fourth-highest-grossing animated film) despite mixed reviews from critics which are being offset by positive audience response. As a result, it received three nominations in the 81st Golden Globe Awards, including Best Animated Feature.

The success of the film would lead to the announcement of a sequel to be released in 2026, called the Super Mario Galaxy Movie.

h4. Cast

* [[Chris Pratt]] / [[Miyano Mamoru]] as [[Mario]]
* [[Anya Taylor-Joy]] / Shida Arisa as [[Princess Peach]]
* [[Charlie Day]] / [[Hatanaka Tasuku]] as [[Luigi]]
* [[Jack Black]] / Miyake Kenta as [[Bowser]]
* Keegan-Michael Key / [[Seki Tomokazu]] as [[Toad (mario)|]]
* [[Seth Rogen]] / Takada Kouji as [[Donkey Kong]]
* Fred Armisen / Kusumi Naomi as [[Cranky Kong]]
* Kevin Michael Richardsen /  Urayama Jin as [[Kamek]]
* Sebastian Maniscalco / Mamiya Yasuhiro as [[Foreman Spike]]
* [[Charles Martinet]] as Mario and Luigi's father as well as Giuseppe, an Italian citizen of Brooklyn who resembles Mario's original appearance in [i][[Donkey Kong (1981 Game)|]][/i]. The brothers' mother as well as uncles Tony and Arthur also appear in the movie.
* Juliet Jelenic / Yamane Ann as [[Lumalee]]

h4. External links

* "Official website":https://thesupermariobros.movie/
other_names: ザ・スーパーマリオブラザーズ・ムービー

title: roy_koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Roy appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like his siblings, Roy uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He uses ground pounds to stun the player, can climb walls and uses his magic [[wand]] to summon magic blasts and purple [[fireball]]s. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he no longer has a wand and now uses a giant [[Bill Blaster|cannon]] to fire [[Bullet Bill]]s. He is also generally regarded as the second most powerful Koopaling after [[Ludwig von Koopa|Ludwig]].

Roy is depicted as being more brawn than brains and preferring to use brute force, though he is rather quick-witted and still more intelligent than [[Morton Koopa Jr.|Morton]]. He is also somewhat of a [[bullying|bully]] who likes to beat people up for fun and has a thing for acting and looking cool. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a pink head. He is the second largest of his siblings after Morton and has a purple [[spiked shell]], large [[fangs]], wears [[pink-framed eyewear|pink]] [[sunglasses]] and is [[bald]].

He is named after Roy Orbison, a famous rock and roll singer, songwriter and guitarist.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31156794: Regular
* !asset #31244783: Dr. Roy

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]]
* [[Princess Roy Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Roy":https://www.mariowiki.com/Roy

title: lemmy_koopa
body:
A character from the [[Mario (series)|Mario series]], he is one of the seven [[Koopalings]] that first appeared in [[Super Mario Bros. 3]]. Lemmy appears in numerous platformers, serving as a world boss in one of the first seven worlds and also appears as a playable character in spin-offs, including [[Mario Kart 8]] and [[Mario Kart Tour]].

Like his siblings, Lemmy uses his [[turtle shell|shell]] to attack and can be defeated by jumping on his head three times. He prefers to use magic [[ball]]s to attack, as he fights while balancing on top of one and uses his magic [[wand]] to summon them. In [[New Super Mario Bros. U]], he now no longer has a wand and now throw [[bomb]]s that explode after a few seconds.

Lemmy is depicted as immature, ditzy and has a childlike innocence about him. He is also somewhat clownish and has a love for the [[circus]], as he would rather join a circus that commit crimes and conquering. Like most of the Koopalings, he wears [[spiked bracelet]]s on each arm and has a mostly [[yellow skin]] complexion, as well as a green head. He is rather small, the smallest of his siblings and has a [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[pink hair|pink]], [[blonde hair|yellow]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[mohawk]] with a ponytail, an orange [[spiked shell]] and is almost always [[cross-eyed]]. 

He is named after [[Lemmy Kilmister]], the lead vocalist/bassist for the English [[rock (music)|]]/[[heavy metal]] band [[motorhead|Motörhead]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31156831: Regular
* !asset #31159674: [[Dr. Lemmy Koopa|Dr. Lemmy]]

h4. See also

* [[Koopalings]] 
* [[Princess Lemmy Koopa]] 

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Lemmy":https://www.mariowiki.com/Lemmy
other_names: レミー(スーパーマリオ)

title: copyright_name
body:
The title of a copyright (a game/manga/anime/series/etc.) written somewhere in a post. Anything with an existing copyright tag qualifies for this tag.

Abbreviations can be used as well. The copyright name may be written in [[English text|English]], Japanese, or in a different language. The title may or may not be written correctly — titles in [[Engrish text|Engrish]] or [[Ranguage]] are welcome here, too.

For example, on an image of [[Final Fantasy VII]]:

* Final Fantasy VII
* FFVII
* ファイナルファンタジーVII
* ファイナルファンタジー
* Final Fantasy 7
* Final Fantasy
* Fainaru Fantajii
* Fainal Fantasy VII (post #382427)
* FF
* etc.

title: nineball_seraph
body:
The upgraded version of [[nineball|Nine-ball]] and final boss of [[armored core: master of arena|Armored Core: Master of Arena]]. It can be distinguished from the standard Nine-ball by its orange highlights and trademark wing-like back thrusters.
It can be considered one the most, if not the most, famous [[mecha]] in the [[Armored Core]] series because of its history and the difficulty of its fights when it appears.

It is associated with [[Cirno]] from [[Touhou]] by fans for the same reasons as its standard version, being one of the strongest ACs and its association with the number 9.
[[Nineball=Cirno]] is commonly depicted with Nine-ball Seraph's color scheme and thrusters.
other_names: ナインボール・セラフ

title: kate_markson
body:
A side character in [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]] [spoiler]who only appears after the player completes two different endings in single save file[/spoiler]. She is an independent mercenary who pilots the AC 'Transcriber', but [spoiler]she is heavily implied to be a fake persona created and controlled by the [[allmind (armored core vi)|ALLMIND]] AI system.[/spoiler]

As an [[Armored Core]] character, she was never depicted as herself canonically, but artist may take inspiration from her likely origin.

title: n-wgix/v
body:
A humanoid [[mecha]] that appears in [[Armored Core: Verdict Day]], piloted by J, leader of the Reaper Squad. It looks similar to [[White Glint]].

According to the spokesperson of the Foundation, N-WGIX/v is one of the machines that have brought destruction upon the world in the past.

title: mizu_(blue_eye_samurai)
body:
The protagonist of [[Blue Eye Samurai]]. A young woman who was forced to disguise herself as man due to being discriminated and hunted for being half Japanese and half British and having [[blue eyes]], she seeks revenge and on four British men who may have raped her mother and gave birth to her. Skilled with the [[katana]], she is often called the [b]Blue Eye Samurai[/b] despite not being from a Samurai family.

Voiced by [b]Maya Erskine[/b].

title: blue_eye_samurai
body:
A 2023 adult 3D animated series created by husband and wife team Michael Green and Amber Noizumi for [[Netflix]]. 

Set in an [[alternate universe|alternate history]] Japan during it's isolation period where the Itoh Clan rather than the Tokugawa Clan ruled Japan and where the British instead of the Dutch are the only Western nation allowed to trade with the Japanese. The series follows [[Mizu_(Blue Eye Samurai)|]], a woman warrior who disguise herself as a man. Discriminated and hunted throughout her life due to being half-Japanese and half-White and having [[blue eyes]], Mizu seeks revenge and kill four British men who she believed raped her mother and gave birth to her, causing misery to her life. With her ruthless skills as a warrior, she is feared as the Blue Eyes Samurai. At the same time, [[Abijah Fowler]], an Irish arms dealer who works for the British, and one of Mizu's possible fathers, is secertly helping rebel clans wanting to overthrow the current Shogunate.

A second season is in the works and is expected to be release in 2026.
other_names: ブルーアイ・サムライ

title: universal_studios
body:
An American film studio, founded in 1912. They're the world's largest major film studio and a member of the "Big Five" major American film studios. They also operate a range of Universal Studios theme parks.
Universal's most commercially successful film franchises include [[Fast & Furious]], [[Jurassic Park]], [[Back to The Future]] and [[Despicable Me]]. Additionally, the studio's library includes many individual films such as [[Jaws (movie)|]] and [[E.T.|E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial]], both of which became the highest-grossing films of all time during their initial releases. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Universal Pictures":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Universal_Pictures]

title: marshall_d._teach
body:
One of the main antagonists of [[One Piece]], also called [b]Blackbeard[/b].

The captain of the Blackbeard Pirates, promoted to [[Shichibukai]] after the downfall of [[Crocodile (one Piece)|]], a title he merely used to break into [[Impel Down]] where he recruited a number of powerful level 6 prisoners. He later became one of the Four Emperors [spoiler]after defeating his former captain [[Edward Newgate]] in the climax of the Summit War of Marineford[/spoiler].

Having consumed the Yami Yami no Mi [[Devil Fruit]] he can basically turn into a black hole and control gravity, as well as capable of nullifying any Devil Fruit user by touching them.

[spoiler]He somehow absorbed [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard's]] shock-creating Gura Gura no Mi powers after his death, becoming the first and possibly only user to possess two [[Devil Fruit]] powers at the same time.[/spoiler]

He is the son of the infamous pirate [spoiler][[Rocks D. Xebec]][/spoiler], making him part of the [spoiler]Davy family[/spoiler], since [spoiler]his father was revealed to have been born Davy D. Xebec[/spoiler].

h4. See also
* [[Blackbeard writing (meme)]]
other_names: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

title: saltire
body:
A heraldic symbol in the form of a diagonal [[cross]], like the shape of the letter [[X (symbol)|]]. Also called Saint Andrew's Cross or [i]crux decussata[/i].

Often used on [[flag]]s (e.g. the [[Scottish flag]]) or [[heraldry]].

Not to be used for random, arbitrary X symbols.

title: mecha_sonic_mki_(8-bit)
body:
One of [[Dr. Eggman]]'s first robotic duplicates of [[Sonic the Hedgehog]], created as part of his Master Robot series in [[Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (8-Bit)]]. With its metallic body, jet turbines, and retractable claw arm, this mechanical doppelganger combines Sonic's speed with deadly weaponry, guarding a [[Chaos Emerald]] in Scrambled Egg as one of Eggman's most formidable early creations.

title: sonic_the_hedgehog_2_(8-bit)
body:
A 1992 side‑scrolling platformer in the [[Sonic (series)|Sonic the Hedgehog series]] made for [[Sega]]’s Master System and Game Gear. Developed by Aspect (with Sega) as the sequel to the 8‑bit Sonic 1, it launched alongside—but is a different game from—the better‑known 16‑bit [[Sonic the Hedgehog 2]] on Genesis/Mega Drive.

title: ahenobarbus_henocied
body:
An edited image based on the "Cursed Image" of a Japanese Ichimatsu doll. The edit features a pale white complexion, a cracked or broken face, exaggerated bloodshot eyes, and a blood-smeared mouth, creating a grotesque and unsettling appearance.

The image is primarily known for its use as a jump-scare image in websites and videos. Its notoriety is also tied to an incident from June 2015, where a Facebook user with the name "Ahenobarbus Henocied" used the image as a profile picture while sending unsolicited NSFW material to minors on the platform.

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Ahenobarbus Henocied":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/ahenobarbus-henocied

title: scylla
body:
A type of [[monster girl]] resembling a sea [[octopus]], most commonly taking the form in Japanese works of a human upper torso and [[tentacles]] for legs.  

Named after a Greek mythological monster that has had many varying descriptions over the centuries.  One later mythological version of the scylla was more or less a [[mermaid]] whose serpentine-like lower half was surrounded by snapping dog heads. For that character, use [[scylla (mythology)]] instead.

Other names associated with octopus girls are Cecaelia and Dagon.

h4. Notable Scyllas
* [[Cthulhy Squele]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Oisha-san]][/i]
* [[Kayla (monwres)|]] from [i][[Monwres: Ishu Kakutou Monster Musume]][i]
* [[kraken (monster girl encyclopedia)|Kraken]] from [i][[Monster Girl Encyclopedia]][i]
* [[Octo (monster musume)|]] from [i][[Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou]][/i]
* [[Okpa]] from [i][[Ishuzoku Reviewers]][/i]
* [[Okutou Hasumi]] from [i][[Hitomi Sensei no Hokenshitsu]][/i]
* [[Rakisu Meitopasu]] from [i][[Mamonomusume to no Seikatsu]][/i]
* [[Scyllei]] from [i][[Shinrabanshou]][/i]
* [[Turquoise (crescendo)|]] from [i][[Shutcho Iyashi Senmon-ten Takoizu]][/i]
* [[Ursula (disney)|]] from [[Disney|Disney's]] [i][[The Little Mermaid (disney)|]][/i]

h4.See also

* [[Mermaid]]
* [[Octopus Boy]]

title: brigid_(arknights)
body:
[i]Brigid, both a free-roaming herdswoman and Catastrophe Messenger, wants to help as much as she can.[/i]

A playable Sniper Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real name: Bridget

A member of Tara's nomadic tribe, the courier, and also the Catastrophe Messenger,
she becomes an Operator to seek Oripathy treatment under [[Reed (Arknights)|]]'s recommendation.

Her motif is based on [[terrier_(dog)|Terrier dogs]].

her [[voice actor]]s are Arisa Sakuraba (JP), Chen Yang (CN), Aoife Dunne (EN), and Kim Yi-an (KR).
Her illustrator is [[yukuso_(dabiandang)|Yukuso]].

title: taihou_(azur_lane)
body:
The personification of the Japanese aircraft carrier [i]Taihou[/i] in [[Azur Lane]]. Character design by [[Yunsang]], voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]].

She has [[long hair|long]], [[black hair]], [[red eyes]], and [[huge breasts|an ample chestline]]. Her default outfit consists of an [[off shoulder]] [[red kimono|red]] [[print kimono]] with a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[red skirt]], a golden crow [[mask]] on her head, [[black thighhighs]], and [[rudder footwear]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of a large metallic fan to her back with her [[flight deck]] on one end.

title: operation_crossroads
body:
Operation Crossroads was a pair of nuclear weapon tests conducted by the United States military at Bikini Atoll in July 1946. The purpose was to investigate the effect of nuclear weapons against warships. The test fleet was largely composed of obsolete and surplus US Navy ships, as well as three surrendered Axis ships. Test Able consisted of a [[nuclear weapon|Mark III]] [[bomb]] dropped from a [[B-29 Superfortress]], while Test Baker consisted of a Mark III bomb detonated underwater. Some of the ships were sunk outright, many were damaged, and almost all were severely radioactively contaminated and had to be scuttled.

Operation Crossroads is sometimes referenced, both in-game and in fan works, by the [[Kantai Collection]] and/or [[Azur Lane]] characters who were historically present:

* Sakawa: [[Sakawa (Kancolle)]] / [[Sakawa (Azur Lane)]]
** Sunk by Test Able.
* [[USS Independence (CVL-22)|]]: - / [[Independence (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived both tests with serious damage and heavily irradiated, scuttled 1951 off the coast of California.
* [[USS Nevada (BB-36)|]]: [[Nevada (Kancolle)]] / [[Nevada (Azur Lane)]]
** Painted orange as the primary target of Test Able; however the bomb was considerably off target. Survived with serious damage and heavily irradiated, scuttled in 1948 near Pearl Harbor.
* [[USS Pensacola (CA-24)|]]: - / [[Pensacola (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived with serious damage and irradiated. Scuttled 1948.
* [[USS Salt Lake City (CA-25)|]]: - / [[Salt Lake City (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived with serious damage and irradiated, sunk as a target ship in 1948.
* [[USS Saratoga (CV-3)|]]: [[Saratoga (Kancolle)]] / [[Saratoga (Azur Lane)]]
** Seriously damaged by Test Able, sunk by Test Baker
* [[Nagato (battleship)|]]:  [[Nagato (Kancolle)]] / [[Nagato (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived Test [i]Able[/i] with "moderate" damage instead of "serious" damage (only ship within 1000 yd/900 m to do so).  Sunk by Test Baker.
* [[Prinz Eugen (cruiser)|]]: [[Prinz Eugen (Kancolle)]] / [[Prinz Eugen (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived with light damage, but still so heavily irradiated that it could not be boarded to repair a leak. Sank under tow five months later. Her starboard propeller and part of her stern remain above water.
* [[USS Pennsylvania (BB-38)|]]: - /  [[Pennsylvania (Azur Lane)]]
** Survived with light damage but still lethally irradiated. Scuttled 1948

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: Operation Crossroads":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Crossroads]
