title: mount_celeb_kaneda-san
body:
An ecchi comedy manga created by [[Nyaromeron]].

The series follows [[Kaneda Mochiko|Mochiko Kaneda]], a rich and glamorous heiress (celeb) to the Kaneda Zaibutsu who constantly tries to flaunt her wealth and social superiority—“mounting” others around her with her money and status. However, her efforts are often undermined by her own clumsiness, poor judgement, or just plain bad luck, resulting in chaotic and humorous mishaps, typically a [[wardrobe malfunction]] that exposes her [[large breasts|voluptuous]] [[curvy|figure]]. Although these perverted accidents are not [[Usui Sachio|limited]] [[Furukawa Tetoko|to]] [[Kaneda Maria|her]].

Nudity in the manga is typically censored by [[Novelty censor|"Kaneda Zaibutsu Approved Censorship Marks"]]. These are small sticker-like censors depicting gold bullions. They're moved out of the way significantly in the manga's volume releases, effectively decensoring the series.

title: windsong_(reverse:1999)
body:
[b]Windsong[/b] is a playable character in [[Reverse:1999]]. She is an Leyline Researcher, going into Rayashki hoping that her research would have practical implementation here. One of the protagonist in the event "Farewell, Rayashki", she helped the townfolk by giving them a clear goal thanks to her finding in Leyline studies, and helped teach students about her study in Leylines.

She is voiced by Yelizaveta Sorkin in English and [[Komatsu Mikako]] in Japanese.

title: laramie_barriga
body:
A character from [i][[Steven Universe]][/i]. Goes by the nickname "Lars".

A teenage Beach City citizen that works at the Big Donut with Sadie. Has a crush on her, but his insensitivity and his irritable behavior get in the way. Desperately wants to be seen as cool and respectable, but most other kids think otherwise.

[spoiler]He dies in "Off Colors" after getting caught in an explosion, but Steven brings him back to life with his tears. He gets a [[scar]] on his left eye and [[pink skin]] and [[pink hair|hair]] from this incident.[/spoiler]

title: racing_colors
body:
Sportswear worn by any given [[jockey]] during a [[horse racing|horse race]]. These are registered through various controlling authorities, as it is meant to represent the owner of the horse.

In the context of [[Umamusume]], while the concept of jockeys are not a thing in the story's universe, the characters' racing outfit is more often than not a reference to the racing color of their real life counterparts.

body:
An outfit typically worn during [[horseback riding]] which usually consists of a [[helmet]] or [[hat]], [[shirt]], [[jacket]] or [[tailcoat]], [[gloves]], [[pants]] or [[jodhpurs]], and [[knee boots|knee-high]] [[riding boots]].

title: vert_(neptunia)
body:
One of four goddesses of Gamindustri, Vert presides over the Land of Green Pastures, Leanbox. She is as she appears: mature, calm, and friendly to all. However, Vert is also a gaming fanatic and will put her wants before her needs. This often leads her to being tired out since she's playing video games almost all the time rather than working. She likes [[yaoi|BL-stuff]], which she keeps as a secret from her friends.

Vert wears a dress that is primarily green with gold markings along with a pink bow that adorns the top of her skirt, as well as green and white gloves. At the collar of her dress is a gold piece with a blue gem in the center along with a maroon and gold ribbon. Vert has [[blonde hair]] [[long hair|that reaches her waist]], along with [[blue eyes]] that aren't always fully open, which may attest to her constant gaming. She has the [[large breasts|second-largest breast size]] of the entire extended cast. Initially the largest, she was dethroned by [[CFW Magic]] in the sequel [[Choujigen Game Neptune Mk2]], who sports an H cup.

Vert is the only CPU who doesn't get a 'sister'. This leads to her being very friendly, almost obsessively so, with the other nations' CPU candidates, particularly [[Nepgear]]. In Re;Birth 1, she also shows a fondness for [[IF (neptunia)|]].

Vert is the personification of the Xbox 360.

Voiced by: [[Satou Rina]] (Japanese), [[Tara Platt]] (English, 2011-2015), [[Carrie Keranen]] (English, 2016-)

h4. See also

* [[Green Heart (neptunia)|]], Vert's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form.
* [[Next Green]], Vert's Next Form

title: compa
body:
Young nurse-in-training who finds [[Neptune (neptunia)|]] stuck headfirst in the ground near her home at the beginning of [[Choujigen Game Neptune]]. Compa is a polite and timid girl who can get tough when the going gets tough. Her choice in attire is what appears to be a wool [[sweater]] with [[detached sleeves]], a rather short [[pleated skirt|pleated]], [[plaid skirt]] with [[kneehighs|kneesocks]] that are lined with hearts at the top. Her boots appear to be made of the same material as her sweater. She also wears a choker with a heart that has a "C" in it and carries a black hip purse that is adorned with hearts and also has a white "C" in a pink circle. Compa has long and curly pink/orange hair that is held back with a [[headband]] that also bears a "C." Her eyes are colored pink/orange as well, albeit in a slightly darker shade. Compa has a bust size that is comparable to [[Vert (neptunia)|]]'s and [[CFW Magic]]'s, as people always tend to comment that she's well-endowed for her age.

Compa is the personification of the game company [[Compile Heart]], the publisher of the [[Neptune (series)|]] series.

Voiced by: [[Sakai Kanako]] (Japanese), [[Cristina Valenzuela]] (English)

title: motoori_kosuzu
body:
The "Bibliophile with a Deciphering Eye". The main character of the official [[Touhou]] manga [i][[Forbidden Scrollery]][/i]. 

A young girl of the Human Village with the ability to decipher books written in any language. She wears a [[checkered]] [[kimono]] and an [[apron]] with "[[name tag|Kosuzu]]" [[clothes writing|written]] in romaji and "Suzunaan" (鈴奈庵) in kanji on the front, has [[red eyes]], [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] and [[two side up]] (or [[twintails]]) adorned with [[hair bell|bells]]. Also wears [[glasses]] when reading.

h4. See also

* [spoiler][[Motoori Kosuzu (Possessed)]][/spoiler]

Not to be confused with [[Maribel Hearn]], who is also often theorized to be a younger Yukari.

title: nigekiri_sisters_(umamusume)
body:
Three (later five) person [[idol]] unit from [[Umamusume]]. Consists of the members [[Smart Falcon (Umamusume)|]], [[Silence Suzuka (Umamusume)|]] and [[Mihono Bourbon (Umamusume)|]], with Falcon leading the group. Later on expanded to five members with [[Ines Fujin (Umamusume)|]] and [[Maruzensky (Umamusume)|]] joining the Sisters.

All five members of the group specialize in the "runner" (nigekiri) pacing strategy during races, hence the name. The name of the group is sometimes translated as "Runaway Sisters" on Danbooru.

The Sisters have their own [[idol clothes|idol outfit]] consisting of a pink-and-white striped [[sleeveless dress]] with a yellow bodice-skirt (resembling a miniature tutu) worn on top. They also wear the Umamusume [[Starting Future (umamusume)|]] outfit in their performances.

This tag should only be used when all three (or five) members are grouped together in a post.

h4. Examples

* !post #6007361
* !post #4871786

title: countdown
body:
Numbers that are counted backwards in fixed units from an arbitrary starting number to mark the time remaining before an event occurs.

On Danbooru, this usually refers to a series of images an artist or a group of artists draw with a number indicating how many days remain until a new character, event, product or series' [[release date]] or an old one's [[anniversary]] or [[birthday]]. They're usually indicated by "あとX日", meaning "X days left".

These illustrations should always be parented or pooled.

It's the opposite of [[event follow-up]], which follows the progress of an event.

Often [[second-party source|posted]] by [[official art|official]] accounts with [[guest art|commissions]] from a variety of popular artists as a way of [[promotional art|promotion]].


h4. Chronological order

* [[announcement celebration]]
* [i]countdown[/i]
* [[release celebration]]
* [[event follow-up]]
* [[ending celebration]]

h4. See also

* [[finger counting]]
* [[countdown illustration]]

title: countdown_illustration
body: An illustration meant to count down the number days before an event such as the release of a video game or series. May or may not include an actual [[countdown]] in the image itself.

title: oguri_cap_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

Nicknamed the "Grey Monster", Oguri Cap is a talented racer with very modest origins, has a strong heartbeat and a [[glutton]]ous appetite. The actual [[Oguri Cap_(racehorse)|]] is named after his sire: Dancing [i]Cap[/i]. 

Oguri has her own spin-off manga titled [[Umamusume: Cinderella Gray]], which has since been adapted into an anime.

Her most salient trait is her appetite, a trait taken from the actual horse. It's often the only trait that is outwardly displayed, often to the point of eating absurd amounts of food as well as trying to eat things that aren't food or other people.

title: ryou_sakazaki
body:
Protagonist of the [[Ryuuko no Ken|Art of Fighting]] series alongside [[Robert Garcia]], and one of the main characters of [[The King of Fighters]] series. His [i]nom de guerre[/i] is 無敵の龍 (Muteki no ryū) - the "Invincible Dragon".

He is the first child and son of [[karate|Kyokugen-ryuu Karate]] founder [[Takuma Sakazaki]]. [[Yuri Sakazaki|Yuri]] is his younger sister. [[Robert Garcia]] is a fellow practicioner of Kyokugen Karate and is Ryo's best friend and rival. [[Marco Rodrigues]] is his most famous disciple. [[King (SNK)|King]] is teased as a love interest of his. He is credited as handing one of the earliest major losses to South Town's young crime lord [[Geese Howard]].

His fighting style is the Tiger discipline of Kyokugen Karate. He is also the first native student to perform the series' most famous [[Haou Shoukou Ken]] and later became a teacher of such a move.

Ryo is credited as the first cross-over/guest character in fighting game history, appearing as a secret boss/playable character in [[Fatal Fury|Fatal Fury Special]]. [[Street Fighter]]'s [[Hibiki Dan|Dan Hibiki]] was created by Capcom to poke fun at him (and Robert) for bearing a bit too close of a resemblance to [[Ryu (Street Fighter)|Ryu]].

title: jam_(umamusume)
body:
A team of three [[horse girl]]s from [[Umamusume]], consisting of [[Jungle Pocket (Umamusume)|]], [[Agnes Tachyon (Umamusume)|]], and [[Manhattan Cafe (Umamusume)|]]. In real life, the three shared the three crowns that make up the Triple Crown of thoroughbred horse racing in 2001.

[[Dantsu Flame (Umamusume)|]] is an honorary member because she frequently competed with the other three, as well as having a large role in the movie, [[Umamusume: Beginning of a New Era]]. For this reason, some works will feature the acronym "JDAM" as well.

This tag should only be used when all three or four of these characters are grouped together in a post.

h4. Examples

* !post #7349481: JAM
* !post #9246343: JDAM

body:
Common [[abyssal ship]] found in [[Kantai Collection]]. A type of enemy aircraft carrier serving the enemy fleet. Has varying levels of status, and may or may not be seen with many planes around her. Often seen with a distinct [[cane]], [[long hair]], and an uncanny human-like appearance.

Due to many puns associated with her, a quirky [[hat]] with [[teeth]] and [[tentacles]], a memetic verbal tic, and being infamous in-game for the Elite variant being extremely hard to sink as well as [[black rock shooter|punning off another series]] in both appearance and name, she has the dubious honor of being one of the most popular enemy ships.

title: charlie_kirk
body:
An American right-wing political activist, author, and media personality, who co-founded the conservative organization Turning Point USA (TPUSA); a non-profit organization that advocates for conservative policies in schools.

On September 10, 2025, Kirk was shot and killed while speaking at a TPUSA event on the campus of Utah Valley University as part of his Prove Me Wrong tour.

title: nekonyaa_(girls_und_panzer)
body:
A character from the series [[Girls und Panzer]].

Tank commander, radio operator and leader of Team [[Anteater]] in a [[Type 3 Chi-Nu]] on the "Ooarai Girls Academy":[#dtext-see-also] tankery team.

Her real name is [b]Nekota Mai[/b] [猫田 舞](ねこと まい).

Voiced by [[Hayama Ikumi]] "[1]":[#dtext-external-links].

[expand=Official Character Bio]

h6. Original Anime

h5. Ooarai Girls Academy / Team Anteater (Online Tank Game Team)

Her team is formed from those she met in an online tank game: Momogaa and Piyotan. She is humble and meek.

[tn]Source: "[2]":[#dtext-external-links] (post #1338697)[/tn]

h6. The Final Chapter

Affiliated with the Ooarai Girls Academy tankery team. Boards the Type 3 Chi-Nu medium tank as the tank commander and radio operator of Team Anteater, made up of friends of an online tank game. Is rumored to be beautiful with her glasses off. Her last name is Nekota.

[tn]Source: "[3]":[#dtext-external-links][/tn]

[/expand]

body:

This meme originated from the 6th episode of the 1st season of Jersey Shore during which Ronnie engages in a physical scuffle with a person on the boardwalk at Seaside Heights, NJ.

title: ikari_yui
body:
A character from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] who was a genetic engineering student. 
She is the beloved mother of [[Ikari Shinji]], former wife of [[Ikari Gendou]], and is considered one of the most important characters in the series despite her not being physically present. 

[spoilers]She disappeared inside the [[EVA 01]] unit during a pilot test, known as a Contact Experiment. It is later revealed that her essence fused with the mecha, turning the EVA 01 into Shinji's actual mother.

[[Ayanami Rei]] is a clone of her made infused with the soul of [[Lilith (Evangelion)|Lilith]] after a failed attempt to salvage her. [/spoilers]

title: yamcha_pose_(meme)
body:
A reference to a scene from [[Dragon Ball]] where [[Yamcha]] is crumpled up in a [[crater]] after being caught in a [[Saibaiman]]'s self-destruction attack.  The pose has become [[meme]]tic as a way of expressing comically defeated characters in fanart and doujins.  

The pose itself involves the character laying down on their right side, face pointed away and viewed feet-first, and with limbs curled halfway into a fetal position. The character in the pose is usually in a smoking crater, even if whatever put them in the Yamcha pose wasn't even an explosive.

h4. Examples

* !asset #22633450

h4. See also

* [[Family Guy Death Pose (meme)|]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Yamcha's Death Pose":http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/yamchas-death-pose
other_names: ヤムチャしやがって・・・

title: variant_set
body:
A post that is part of an image set containing a base image and one or more alternate versions. Some part of the base image must remain unchanged (usually the character's pose).

Common examples of changes within the set are:

* Different costumes, outfits, or [[underwear]]
* Different stages of undress
* Text and [[textless version]]s
* Changing [[speech bubble]]s for ongoing conversations
* Changes in facial expressions
* Different stages of sex acts
* Slight changes in pose (usually just the limbs)

[b]Correct[/b]
* Post #212868
* Post #8179883
* Post #4073734 (NSFW)

[b]Incorrect[/b]
* Post #6368195
* Post #8004000
* Post #3884324

Images in variant sets must contain intentional, significant changes made by the artist. The following do not count as part of a variant set:

* [[Revision]]s
* [[Duplicate]]s
* Compressed/uncompressed versions
* [[Censored]]/[[uncensored]] versions

Not to be confused with [[variations]], which are multiple variations within the [i]same[/i] image.

[b]If the set contains 6 or more images, use [[large variant set]].[/b]

h4. See also

* [[large variant set]]
* [[textless version]]

title: akashi_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of Japanese Repair Ship [i]Akashi[/i] (明石).

In her base art, she is a [[cat girl]] with [[green hair|green]] [[very long hair]] and an [[ahoge]]. She has a [[mole under eye|mole under her]] [[yellow eyes]]. On her neck is a [[red ribbon|red]] [[ribbon choker|ribbon]], [[neck bell|bell]] [[choker]]. She wears a [[double-breasted]] [[white dress]], with a [[sailor collar]] and [[sleeves past fingers|sleeves past her fingers]], with [[tools]] coming out of her wrist. Her [[rigging]] is composed of a giant [[wrench]] and a [[crane_(machine)|mechanical crane]].

In game, she appears as both an obtainable unit and the premium store owner. Since players must interact with her whenever they wish to purchase the premium currency ([[gem (azur lane)|gems]]) with real money, she's portrayed as very greedy in her fanwork.

Voiced by [[Uesaka Sumire]].

title: pompadour
body:
A hair style in which the front hair is swept up from the forehead into a high roll at the top of the head. Often exaggerated in animation to comical proportions. Popular with rockers (particularly [[Elvis Presley|Elvis]] impersonator), gang members, and other rebels.

The Japanese often misunderstand the pompadour as the "リーゼント (regent style)."

title: sabrina_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Sabrina[/b], known as [b]Natsume[/b] in Japan, is a character introduced in [[pokemon rgby|Pokémon Red and Green]].

A powerful psychic herself, this Gym Leader who uses Psychic types can see the future with her precognitive powers. She allegedly does not like conflict. Her signature Pokémon is [[Alakazam]].

In her [[pokemon frlg|FRLG]] outfit, she has [[red eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[black hair|hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears a [[bodysuit]], a [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[red jacket|red]] [[turtleneck jacket|turtleneck]] [[long sleeves|long-sleeve]] jacket, [[white gloves|gloves]], a [[red skirt|red]] [[side slit]] [[pencil skirt|pencil]] [[miniskirt]], [[yellow thighhighs|yellow]] [[over-kneehighs]], and [[red boots]].

In her [[pokemon hgss|HGSS]] outfit, she has red eyes, [[medium hair|medium]] [[flipped hair]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[pink camisole]] that exposes [[midriff]], large [[bracelet]]s, [[white pants]], and [[pink slippers]].

title: tezuka_rin
body:
[[Katawa Shoujo]] character.

Rin is a girl who was born with short, malformed arms that were subsequently [[amputee|amputated]]. Her birth defect was due to the side effects of the drug "thalidomide":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thalidomide. To make up for her [[armless amputee|lack of arms]], she uses her feet to accomplish everyday tasks with surprising dexterity. She has [[short hair|short]] [[red hair]] and dark [[green eyes]], and wears a boy's uniform to avoid awkward situations that would arise from using her feet while wearing a skirt. 

Rin is a painter and has a penchant for getting lost in her thoughts. 

She is [[Ibarazaki Emi]]'s friend and roommate.

title: rose_quartz_universe
body:
Former leader of the Crystal Gems, a resistance force to prevent her Homeworld from destroying the Earth. Mother of [[Steven Quartz Universe]]. Died when she gave up her physical form to give birth to her son.

[spoiler]Initially believed to have shattered [[Pink Diamond (steven universe)|]], one of the four leaders of Homeworld.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]In truth she secretly [i]was[/i] Pink Diamond all along, Rose Quartz being a fabricated persona.[/spoiler]

body: Microraptor (Greek, μικρός, mīkros: "small"; Latin, raptor: "one who seizes") is a genus of small, [[multiple wings|four-winged]] [[raptor|dromaeosaurids]]. Numerous well-preserved fossil specimens have been recovered from Liaoning, [[china|PRC]].

title: city
body:
A relatively large and permanent settlement. Cities generally have complex systems for sanitation, utilities, land usage, housing, and transportation. The concentration of development greatly facilitates interaction between people and businesses, benefiting both parties in the process. A big city or metropolis usually has associated suburbs and exurbs. Such cities are usually associated with metropolitan areas and urban areas, creating numerous business commuters traveling to urban centers for employment. Once a city expands far enough to reach another city, this region can be deemed a conurbation or megalopolis.

Not to be confused with [[City (Arawi Keiichi)|the comedy manga series]]. 

h4. See also

* [[architecture]]

* [[city lights]]
* [[cityscape]]

* [[suburb]]
* [[town]]
* [[urban]]

title: mob_x_character
body:
A non-background character that is not taggable as any existing character and has no unique design traits that would make it taggable as an [[original]] character. Essentially, a character that would usually be an extra who takes an active role in the image.

Mob characters usually have one or more of the following traits:
* Are partially or fully [[faceless]] assuming the head is visible in the shot.
* Are given less attention to detail than the main subject(s) of the image; at times almost completely featureless.
* Take up little space in the shot relative to the main subject(s).

The following may also apply for NSFW posts:
* Little more than the mob character's genitals and the surrounding area are visible.
* The character is meant to be treated as a self-insert for the viewer (common in [[pov]] works) above all else.

title: lysithea_von_ordelia
body:
Character in [[Fire Emblem: Three Houses]] and member of the Golden Deer.

She has [[long_hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[pink eyes]], and is [[flat_chest|flat-chested]].

She is a hardworking girl with a no-nonsense attitude who has a desire to improve her abilities. Being the youngest student at 15-years-old, she dislikes being treated like a child and can be impatient with those who annoy her. Despite wanting to look independent and mature, she has an intense fear of ghosts and is an avid lover of sweets, especially cake.

In-game, Lysithea is a very potent mage with unparalleled offensive power, but she has terrible defenses. She is often considered a "Glass Cannon" character, able to annihilate all but the toughest of opponents.

[spoiler]The reason for her impatience is because of her shortened lifespan, caused by being imbued with a second Crest when she was experimented on by Those Who Slither in The Dark.[/spoiler]

Remarkably, she ended in the Top 2 of the 2020's edition of "Choose Your Legends":[https://vote4.campaigns.fire-emblem-heroes.com/en-US/results] (women's side), making her the first non-main character to get a Brave unit in [[Fire Emblem Heroes]].

Voiced by: "Janice Kawaye":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Janice_Kawaye] (English), [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese).

h4. Appearance

title: ring_light
body:

Originally designed as a flash for cameras, but with improved energy usage gave way for the development of continuous lights.

title: constricted_pupils
body:
Use when the pupil is noticeably smaller than usual relative to the iris or when the iris is omitted to emphasize the smallness of the pupil, sometimes extremely small (almost dot-like).  Can variously be elements of the eyes of a character in extreme fear, reacting to some shock or simply undergoing an autonomous reflex from exposure to bright light.

h4.See also

* [[Crazy eyes]]
* [[Dilated pupils]]
* [[Wide-eyed]]
* [[Sanpaku]]
* [[Tag Group:Eyes Tags]]

title: sanpaku
body:
Eyes that noticeably show the whites around most of the iris during a state of rest. Can also indicate anger, exhaustion, or a dangerous demeanor. Sometimes referred to as "Dead fish eyes" among Western speakers.

The Japanese expression literally translates to "three white" as in the whites of the eyes being visible to three of four sides of the iris when the person with sanpaku eyes is looking straight ahead or when their eyes are at rest. 
The most extreme form is called [i]shihakugan[/i], meaning "four-white eyes".

h4. Examples

* !post #4905216
* !post #7732758
* !post #2470147

h4. See also

* [[constricted pupils]] 
* [[jitome]] - eyes topped with a flat line
* sanpaku - eyes that show white primarily above or below the iris
* [[tareme]] - eyes with a rounded, drooping shape
* [[tsurime]] - eyes with an upward outer "point"
* [[upturned eyes]] - eyes also with whites visible below the iris, but with a soft, gentle expression looking upwards rather than a harsh or unhinged one.
* [[wide-eyed]] - eyes that show white around normal iris
* [[Tag Group:Eyes tags]]

h4. External links

* Pixivision: "Drawings of Girls with Sanpaku Eyes - Strength is in the Eyes":[https://www.pixivision.net/en/a/5822]

title: seia_(swimsuit)_(blue_archive)
body:
The [[swimsuit]] [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Blue Archive]]'s [[Seia (blue archive)|]].

Seia [[side ponytail|tied her hair sideways into a ponytail]] and wearing a [[yellow visor]] [[visor cap|hat]]. She wears a [[red choker]], highleg [[white one-piece swimsuit]] with a diamond-shaped [[cleavage cutout]] on the chest, a [[yellow jacket]] that she puts halfway through her wrist, and large [[yellow sandals]] that resemble boots.

One of Seia's possible expressions is a relaxed face that resembles [[Frieren|Frieren's]] (as seen below), a reference to the fact that she [[voice actor connection|shares the same]] [[Tanezaki Atsumi|voice actress as her]].

The car that she drives in her EX-skill animations is a [[jaguar e-type|Jaguar E-Type Series 3 Roadster]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9658685: Profile

title: originium_arts_(arknights)
body:
In the world of [[Arknights]], this is effectively magic.

This tag should be used for operators using Originium Arts.
